5uCm10u3yYlz9ogvZo0Ohw.text: Food was just ok. The service was very poor.   For an airport restaurant I would expect them to try and push you out. Not my waitress nor the others. I had to ask for a knife, then jelly then the check. I had to ask a manager for the knife. I was never asked if I wanted my water refilled. If you decide to eat here and get a waitress named Jessica I suggest you run away.

IuSzEcARc4EkLOK205wi9w.text: Great food, flavors, snack options, and environment with outlets for charging, a couch area, and overall plenty of space and great service.

RI2E5-Mh9kgo9qCvf5-pJg.text: Meal was excellent.  We had the Mushroom and Crab pasta for dinner and was happy to see the one portion was enough for 2 people. The pasta was cooked perfectly and you could taste the mushrooms and crab.  We will definitely look for this restaurant in the Dallas area.

KNeiRiB-FveA5xQ-vdSqvw.text: My new favorite Airport Restaurant!  1897 Market is a cross between a cool rustic bistro and a market.  I had the Reuben from the Deli area and it was fantastic.  My friend started with 1/2 dozen oysters from the raw bar and followed it up with a fantastic burger (he says the best he has ever had, it has homemade pickles on it!).  We both had a Manhattan that was made perfectly.  The service was friendly and prompt, the music was great and the whole place had a real cool vibe.  Little did we know that our flight would be delayed so we went back and grabbed a local IPA out of the cooler and sat in the back area where they have big overstuffed chairs and couches.  I will never visit the US Airways club again.  This lounge area in the back is my new go to spot on CLT layovers!  Can't wait to get back to CLT to try the hand tossed pizza.  The table next to us ordered one and it looked and smelled delicious!

bhB_S6A35NJ3Wresja8_JQ.text: Absolutely amazing food! I've been lucky enough to go through the airport a few times lately and I always made it a priority to stop in to eat or pick up something to go. The Parmesan Herb Chicken Tenders are delicious as well as the Carved Turkey & White Cheddar Omelet. What blew me away though was their breakfast pizza. It was A.M.A.Z.I.N.G!!! So delicious and full of flavor. Excellent restaurant, do yourself a favor and stop by when you are in the Charlotte airport.

hxIa8pEBHcg-E7noV9utsg.text: This is probably the best airport bar in the U.S.  I travel for business 3 weeks a month and this is by far my favorite. Tons of space, charging stations at the bar, an amazing beer list and great food. If you are in CLT for more than 30 minutes you have to stop by.

7yeB8tjLiFXsX6_w5etOcw.text: Got a pre-made sandwich called "Italian Job" which is your standard Italian sub sandwich.  Absolutely nothing special, bread  slightly old, lettuce fully wilted and meat was light on taste.  The price is high for what you get but in line with pre-made so-called gourmet sandwiches you get from the grab and go selection at airport eateries.   At 930 calories, $10 and absolutely no redeeming attributes in terms of palatability, I won't get their sandwiches again.

_20kUXlyxB8Zaldw5S_hzg.text: Started with an Old Fashion and was happy I did. The whiskey cured cherries added a delicious flavor to this perfect drink. I followed it with the Salmon salad. Although it was a little over cooked the sweet crisp glaze complimented the salty flavor of the fish. If I ever fly through Charlotte again I will definitely drop by 1897 again. Great spot and well priced for the upscale eats in an airport.

Jo-3naFutjB5xZvHEP1q-g.text: Large portions and better than average food. Good local beer on tap. We had dirty Mac and cheese. Burger is big enough to share. Fun to have a small market as well to

PKtQYG8l5Pdo_J-Jdczfhw.text: Had a wonderful meal in between flights! Highly recommended to make a stop for a sit down or take away snack or meal. Fresh food and nice selection.

8DGzntOXNk5fU6zLKQV82w.text: I had a layover at CLT airport and walked by this place so I decided to sit at the bar for a drink, some lunch, and to charge my phone. The bartender up-sold me to a double cocktail, and I ordered the salmon salad. The salad was different, it had actual chunks of trail mix aka granola in it, but it was pretty good, and the salmon itself was delicious! They also had football on so that was good to pass the time. If I was in the area again I would certainly come back.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon Salad
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States

g0FTo_QtO5vwIbuBsybX4w.text: Meh.  Another airport restaurant.  I had the spinach/mushroom pizza which was just fine, light and crispy.  The service leaves a lot to be desired.  They are really understaffed and it took an hour and a half to get a drink and a pizza.  Not a good thing for an airport restaurant.  If you have the time and don't want refills on your drink, the food is fine, but if you're in a hurry try somewhere else.

UrM-Q-TSzn-NS2wtW-zbIQ.text: Table service in the airport, was quick, burger was good, but Parmesan fries were lacking. Not bad for airport, but there are better places outside the airport.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Parmesan fries: A for presentation, C for taste.

reOMOe7G5JD74Nb9OPXzFw.text: Stopped by here for a healthy option. After speaking to the friendly hostess I chose to go with the Salmon.  It was served with baby carrots, baby squash, onions, arugula and mustard seed.    The veggies were delicious and the salmon was cooked to perfection. I often have salmon at airports and it is over cooked 90% of the time.    The server, Cesar, was friendly, attentive but didn't linger.  I was working on my phone a bit and he'd check in quickly so as not to disturb me.  Last night, I had a server at another restaurant that wanted to tell me his life story while I was trying to focus on my work.  The only reason for the one star that is missing is the sauce/mustard seed was a bit overbearing.    All in all, this is a great spot for a quick, healthy bite.

m23-erQz57M0VjWrZUbllQ.text: Good place to sit down and eat a decent meal in a pretty crowded and busy airport. This place is rather strange. Coming in from concourse B, you see a door and stairs. this takes you into a kind of store of some sort. Weave through there, and you come into a small restaurant kind of place. The entrance and seating person from the restaurant is in the atrium area. The omelet I had was pretty good, but not anything special. Service was ok but not inspiring. All in all it was better than a fast food place, and at least it was relatively quiet.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Coffee with a cute creamer and sugar trough
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Eggs and cheese, sausage and home fries
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Goat cheese omelet

btnmOawYDmwea2WDNhXAfw.text: Service slower than you would like at an airport. Fries were dry. Hamburger cooked as desired. We asked what size burger was staff didn't know. Beer wasn't cold.

hZs48bzq9Us8KDjtMK3FMA.text: I recently had a layover in the Charlotte airport and stopped by 1897 Market for a quick bite. It was actually my second time there. Last time I was at 1897, they didn't have the bar section, or maybe I didn't see it. Either way, I was pleasantly surprised to see this section of the restaurant and to spot oysters on the menu! Both, the drinks and the oysters, were pretty good and reasonably priced. Places like 1897 Market help make traveling much more enjoyable.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. The world is my oyster

_MSyFPuuaRqEmW5cV0vkTg.text: First and possibly the last time I do breakfast here. Ordered the Classic Breakfast with eggs over easy and bacon. Eggs were overcooked almost burnt and bacon was so overcooked it shattered. Would have given them two stars but when I complained they gave me another plate that was slightly better. It was something of a grease bomb. Oh and if you order a mimosa order a side of OJ. I'm all for alcohol but dang this was orange flavored sparkling wine...not a mimosa. That might be good for some folks but it was way too early for that much alcohol. Have done lunch here plenty of times and will do it again...but not breakfast.

YrH8TDqN9YpYU6UjnlvE7Q.text: I have finally found a good place to eat at the Charlotte airport!  I had the Neese's Country Burger, which convinced me the pimento cheese is a legitimate cheese for a burger.  The bacon the the burger was also think and crispy.  I upgraded to the carrots with caramelized onions.  Both were delicious though the carrots were piping hot and the burger had cooled off more than ideal.  I also love that most tables have chargers and purse hooks - great for an airport establishment.  I have finally found a food home at CLT!

z-84wVz_BQGaC0NbsXSI8A.text: Came to the deli side.  You order at the counter, then walk across the market to pay.  Come back and sit at the bar.  When your food is ready, they don't bring it to you or tell you it's ready, you just have to keep an eye out.  I had the pizza, it was not that good, tasted like a cardboard box with cheese.

pksOhlgATAf63e5okqBk2A.text: The service is 4-Star.  They lost a star because they would not substitute the type of salad (they had Apple Pear, I just wanted a simple house salad because of my diet protocol). You can't make this up, wouldn't substitute a cheaper type salad----disappointed as many venues understand customers are ordering low-carb meals to improve their health.  Overall, this is a nice venue and the service has always been friendly.  Portions are nice and the food has always been good.

VMX3vbDWW6u6jUVf0mqwAA.text: Overpriced but it's an airport so what can you expect. I ordered the Charlotte burger and it tasted like just about any plain-ish burger I've had in my life. Nothing special. Was hoping to find something to perk up my layover and this didn't really do the job unfortunately.

GWUCUCsbpO9bSKDlOKYDkA.text: The presentation is excellent. The flavors are just average. The chicken Parmesan frittata was decent, and the breakfast pizza was okay. The food tastes under seasoned, so you may want to add a bit more yourself. Maybe they haven't updated their recipes since 1897.

zCF4jyNNDWZMS3dCMQHeDA.text: This is my new CLT airport food spot! A much better burger and fries than Bad Daddy's burger, just sayin'. I had the classic Charlotte Burger which was flavorful, crispy and juicy. I will visit again!

raoPoDHAG6NiaXVwi5FGgg.text: If you want to forget all your troubles order the Cable Car! My carnivorous-only eating partner loved it. I think he forgot about his go-to Grand Marnier....He ordered the 1lb of buffalo chicken wings. They were ok. Great portion, large wings, but not enough sauce and I think they were slightly undercooked. I had the French onion soup and roasted root vegetables w/goat cheese. Both were amazing and so filling. We stuck to appetizers because they were rather pricey, but offer a wonderfully fresh menu of salmon, shrimp, trout and creative pizzas and burgers at the airport.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Local NC Chicken Wings with OK sauce
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Roasted Root Veggies
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rustic decor

_0K3EBdH5kbpuYnxaHnNiA.text: This is hands-down one of the best airport restaurants I've ever eaten at. I can actually order a salmon salad and glass of Chardonnay and know it will be great. The French onion soup is amazing too. You can get plenty of healthy & local options which you know can be tough to find while traveling. I eat here every time I have a layover in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spring Salmon Special

0LcjgnhYQP9AdPoKvUhOWA.text: This is the best place to eat at CLT. I really don't understand the negativity here, No restaurant will be perfect when located inside an airport, and 1897 is no exception. That being said, there are 3 reasons why 1897 is awesome!  1) Good beer selection - Noda Hop Drop N roll, Zero Dark Thirty IPA, and a few others!  2) Great food - Wife and I split Turkey Sandwich and the chicken Pesto pizza. Both were cooked perfectly and the pizza was extra delicious. The best part? Those delicious parm fries.  3) price - would you rather spend $10 dollars and go to BK or come here and spend $10 dollars to get a hand roasted turkey sandwich? or a pizza? or a number of other things? I know what one I will pick.  1897 is a nice place to spend a layover! Don't let the 3.5 star throw you off.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States

5mZ8OMW3Uke9admQNs9n8A.text: Nice quiet place to chill at the airport. I'll will go back anytime I fly through CLT.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States

9MSE5w-0OpWx8V9ayEnm7A.text: Went in for a paleo box and kombucha (it's advertised everywhere in the store) and they were all out. Did not look like there was a spot for any of them anywhere in the market to begin with. Store team didn't know when they were supposed to be refilled. Really let down. will not be coming back

N-eZZiIG54o6FOptXL_H2w.text: Everything was fresh and service was great. This is definitely not your typical airport restaurant. The prices were reasonable and they had a full menu.

S5Rl3W0LzNbuLB3A0ZHZtA.text: Big fan of this place.  The food is just outstanding - and not only for airport food.  This is a go to spot for me for every meal in CLT.    My only complaint about this place is the lack of flexibility the market offers.  Trying to go "off menu" on any level is met with resistance.  For example, I tried to order just a simple side of eggs (they have egg sandwiches, so this should easily be possible) and I was told this isn't possible from the market and I have to go to the restaurant.  Although not a huge deal, it is a bit inconvenient given that it's the same spot.    All in all, though, highly recommended.

WLvqark-6OR_xmiquQJj5w.text: I had a 2 hours wait at the airport and decided to make a stop here. This was one of the few places that had seats. The waitress was very nice and helpful! I had a cocktail and it was great. The burger was pretty good and they cooked it as I requested. That said, I asked for non bun and maybe because of that there was a lot of fat.

l32jVs77WR7782uEMbNbig.text: Okay I stopped in for breakfast....at 10:15 on a Sunday. Said they stopped serving breakfast at 10:00.  Sad.  Ordered chicken fingers:  received three giant breasts.  Fried, tough, sad....don't recommend. Breakfast should be served all day in the weekends.

kRZdupQ6xwKLFiT57K0N5A.text: I can't comment on lunch or dinner but breakfast is not their strong suit.  The Slam sounds good on the menu but it neglects to mention that every thing is piled on top of each other--eggs, grits, salad.  Ask for the standard condiments such as ketchup,  jam, butter and the waitress had to dole it out in small plastic cups--apparently these items are not considered part of the faire.

YcYcqQjlhfT0h636eBNKkg.text: This place lacks customer service. We were apparently interrupting social time and they kept forgetting our waters and didn't bring out ketchup until the end of our meal.  Food is ok.  On the greasy side....different restaurant next time I pass through Charlotte.

RbPmwEQu53u5ASm4ROHLFQ.text: I didn't have any of the issues stated in other reviews. The staff was wonderful and accommodating and the food was probably some of the best airport food I have ever had. More airports should have this type of place. I will be returning. Adding some soup to the menu would be even better.  Added bonus, there are outlets everywhere.  Yay!

VBXrYc_1Yr73BkqMBwOjzg.text: This place has one of the best burgers I've ever had. I have sent so many people here. I travel every week and used to always eat here. But today's customer service experience has sealed their fate. I have had over an hour wait. I have been bathed at by bartenders, and I have been told I cannot call in a to-go order. Really? You don't want my money? Fine.

77HhCjwTOqhhoUsLyJ1WvQ.text: The onion soup is over salty , the burger was ok the American mule was OK but not good. I don't sure that I will stop again in this restaurant.  The classic American food is really weak!

yKhkTYWuseBXiji-m_hEbw.text: This was the worst food and drink experience I have ever had in an airport. The place was crowded and looked like a great spot for a drink and some lunch between flights. We ordered a round of bloody Mary's that were literally warm on the bottom and chilled at the top. Tasted like sweet clam juice. Terrible!!!  I wasn't completely turned off at this point since some places just don't know how to make a good Bloody Mary. We then ordered the french onion soup because I saw several go by the table and it looked delicious. The soup itself was luke warm with soggy croutons. The cheese on top however looked amazing. After eating the cheese off the top, I was over the soup. They were scooping the warm soup out of a container and then putting cheese on top and in the oven to melt. Flavor not good and barely warm. Next  was our grilled chicken and mushroom sandwich. Thank god we got one to share because we weren't starving. My boyfriend scarfed his half down (which doesn't say much because he'll eat anything) and when I went to take the first bite the smell alone was a no go. The bread was stale and the smell was horrific. I took a half a bite and spit out in my napkin. Our waitress came around and picked up my half of sandwich and fries that I didn't touch, the soup missing the cheese only and two bloody Mary's 3/4 full and never once asked how the meal was. That was the worst $65 I have ever spent in my life. I typically don't write reviews but if I can save someone from eating at this place it's worth it. Wish I would have grabbed a chic filet sandwich instead!

Cx9mDrjlCBhQvvspbFpaZQ.text: I came here during my layover at Charlotte Int'l. I was looking for a place with good food and drinks. I ordered the chicken sandwich which was pretty tasty. It had a real chicken breast (not that fake processed stuff), and it also came with their garlic Parmesan fries. I wasn't a big fan of those because they seemed like frozen fries. The waitress recommended a local Amber beer which was also good. She was kind and attentive. It's a good place to dine at if you're in the airport.

DjTvHWIJ89TEHWU9ENmU6g.text: Wife and I stopped here for a layover 3rd week of May 2016.  99% sure she got her food poisoning from the burger here.  Washed hands prior to eating but unfortunately she spent the next 2 days with massive cramps and body aches and some not so pleasant GI issues.  Wouldn't recommend stopping by.

QIhNPHRMMFGaBE8JWsBTAA.text: Finally had enough of a layover to try a new restaurant. Honestly this was good for airport food and prices. Lots of power outlets which is much appreciated in a airport that doesnt have the abundance of others. I had the roasted root vegetables appetizer and thumbs up!

FJ95MPgiVCpiorUxNQjLNQ.text: I had the truffle chicken sandwich and a side salad. The side salad was tasteless but the truffle chicken sandwich was quite good. Good truffle flavor, well cooked chicken, and overall pleasant flavor.

vk5WNIHQOH_1EeQMFWmClw.text: Server REBECCA 325087 increased her own tip, so watch out for that one.    Fries were cold, overwhelming seasoning. Service was slow. I asked for no tomato on sandwich, but it had tomato on it. Yucky seeds and tomato "goo" ruins it for me, but I didn't send it back because it was so slow and I was starving. I'm glad I didn't send it back. Rebecca steals so she probably spits in food, too (or worse).

dqWNmqWFJ773_gQPu0hedA.text: Good pizza and local brews....went to the deli/market on the backside.  Saves time if you're able to find a seat.

tpDEIF1HSwuLw1S8Ib4F8Q.text: Cheese grits were AWESOME! Best breakfast in CLT airport! The bacon was very good too. Highly recommend.

RucwWGrnIiObuP9p3S1ewQ.text: Quality and flavor of the food was great. The service was AWFUL. I'm sitting 5 feet from the prep window and somehow my food was delivered cold. Also, Shannon, the waitress pretty much forgot I was there. Waited over 10 minutes for coffee. Next time I'll go to the self serve area.

Uj5Rm4dLp9-Acgf7o2Mw8A.text: The Mahi Mahi is incredible, shrimp and grits is amazing and the cocktails are fabulous! Will be the new pit stop every time I'm in Charlotte which is every month!

b1copKVxcXCfxBzLwMEF8g.text: This place is a mess.   Arrived at 915 and found this place as a welcome reprieve from the fast food wasteland in every airport.  The hosts were so uninterested we had to get their attention(3 of them). We were seated and not greeted for 15 mins.  No kids menu food and out of chicken tenders.  Restaurant was at 50% capacity  We sat next to kitchen and it was awful to hear the staff talking to one another pretty inappropriately. Talk of "threesomes" was pretty prevalent.   I had the truffle chicken sandwich and it was a half breast that was cooked to oblivion.  The pizza was so greasy we used two napkins to sop up grease.   The manager swung by and regretfully I couldn't stay to talk to her because we had to catch our connection. She was very nice, and I wish I had a chance to give her feedback directly.  It's hard to judge a place in the airport based on usual standards but this place can and should do so much better. All people need is a smiling and welcoming face at the host stand to drive more business. You need attentive servers for weary travelers. You need well cooked food as well.  This is coming from someone with 20 years in food service and management.

yUHI7Vd3Q8T1YPl0_2ttDA.text: A really terrific choice of you find yourself at the Charlotte airport.  I had a pizza that was just big enough for a ravenous appetite.   The cost of specialty drinks was ridiculous but it's an airport.  They have you prisoner.  A very simple but very solid bar fare.  Even a burger with hot dog slices on it that looked really good.  If you want something better than fast food head here

KjSgGi4C21_HRq90bqbw4A.text: I fly into this airport almost every week and never really stopped here. I have my favorites, but this place was pretty solid for a good hot sandwich. Much more expensive than some of the other places in CLT, but was still good. Service was a little slow - might stop here again on the flight back!

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States

pXCHM8u1jJPIeQkF7jx0hw.text: A must stop at the CLT airport!!   Why waste time with the normal fast food places when you can enjoy the same type place you search for on Yelp?   The food is spot on and the service is friendly. If you are tight on time to catch your next flight let them know. They are very accommodating.   Pro Tip: Tight on time, but still want to sit down and enjoy your meal? Ask for the check as you order your food. One less thing to wait for.   Now that we got through all the reasons why you wanted fast food and didn't stop at this gem, let's talk about the food:  Tried the Reese's Country burger. I highly recommend it. Don't add anything extra to it ( i.e. Ketchup, mustard... ) just take a bite, it's burger bliss as is... The parmesan cheese fries go really well with this burger.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Neese&#39;s Country Burger

ADZEfhIovBnbL5LQnYumUQ.text: Tasty turkey truffle on ciabatta sandwich (I omitted the cheese).  Not inexpensive but best $10 sandwich I have had at an airport. This market has some healthy and not so healthy gourmet snacks, beverages and craft beers to grab preflight. Good girl and more Local Sweet Girl cookies. Kevita Kombucha, indiana popcorn, kale tortilla chips & more...

l5NJOKoq7PhJOzwsLlXxRQ.text: My husband and I had a "date" here when we were stuck in the Charlotte Airport for a few hours.  The menu is small but you can get sandwiches, salads, or entrees so there is something for anyone.  Its an open kitchen concept so I like that I can see what's going on with my food.  I had a chicken sandwich and my husband had a burger.  Both were really good.  The meats were juicy and the toppings were spot on.  The fries were coated in parmesan and were crispy and hot.  The service was friendly but on this night kind of on the slow side.  No biggie when we needed something, we got it, so it didn't hold us up at all.  The pilot at the table next to us had a pasta dish that looked amazing.  I'll have to try that sometime.   All in all a good choice for a nice relaxing dinner at the airport.  If we didn't have our suitcases next to us I would have never guessed I was in an airport.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States

TuDA0SX6DUAVy5NHLwbjcw.text: For a spot in the airport, we were impressed. The beer and food was great! We'll make it a stop on our next visit for sure!

0mECw-FAtX7hzG--ce3QLg.text: My Go to for any food on a layover at CLT,  always look forward to grabbing a Pizza or Roasted Turkey Sandwich. they have a broad menu thou for those looking for a good meal at the airport. Great selection of beverages and the desserts are awesome as well. there is  various seating types to fit you layover needs if you don't want to head back to the Admiral club.

dnLv0vQynpRTR6LwxuTAAg.text: Breakfast was good. The bacon crisp potatoes were tender and crispy. Waitress was fun and very accommodating. I would recommend this place for breakfast.

OxM72Fe-W20OFLOOL4axlA.text: Worst experience ever!  I've had the privilege of eating at the 1897 market several times, non issue.  It appears the waitress was having a tough day, and I was the lucky customer to feel her wrath.  I get it, some customers are naturally displeasing, and disrespectful.  That should not give the waiters (s) the right to gauge other customers and treat us the same.  Not entirely sure if I'll return.

qCeWsfaItT1BsHb6Z_yByA.text: Really, dahlinks, if one must travel, one must appreciate civilizing influences. 1897 is the epitome: bottles of Excellent Pinot Grigio Vignetti Delle Dolomiti. Ask for a glass, and it will be arrive at your luxurious chair, nestled in a dimly lit man-cave next to conveniently located plugs!  They have thought of everything!!!

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. TV in lounge area!!
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Power!! Yes!
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. My home away from home

y2EMVt9DIhoQ1DfMcWFPtQ.text: While I am never excited to hang in the airport, if I find myself with extra time in CLT, 1897 Market is my go-to place.  To be clear, this is not a review of the restaurant itself - I've never sat down and had a meal here.  But, if you head to the back area, there's a little market with snacks and sandwiches and, if you keep going, a seating area with really comfortable couches and chairs.    Extra time - do yourself a favor and avoid stress by relaxing here.

AhXW4qfOtUqN6QAWSckHeQ.text: Take my money...Take all of it!  The food and drinks here are ABSOLUTELY amazing. Great Mai Tai, Great beer. The Pizza was amazing, as well as the burger. Definitely a good stop when at CLT airport.  We sat in the lounge area which was really comfortable. Not the best for a "table" experience, but really good to be able to recharge your batteries, both literally and figuratively. Cesar was our server and he was very efficient. Beer recommendations were perfect.   We were STUFFED.   Definitely will come again.   ps... it aint cheap!

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nice lounge to relax and recharge

iNX6ohN50p4SeudIpTB-sw.text: CLT layover junkies, unite! In my unintentional quest to eat at every spot at the Charlotte airport, 1897 Market was next on my hit list.   I asked to be seated at a table, rather than a hightop near the bar since I was in the mood for  a more leisurely meal. The hostess led me around and around to a seating area near the marketplace. This place is big!   To eat, I ordered a pizza and Caesar salad. In True airport dining fashion, the food came out quick! I was actually impressed by the quality of the pizza. It was thin, crispy, and had a nice balance of sauce, cheese, and toppings.   The only turnoff was the very end when it took seemingly forever to pay. My waiter was staring at the TV and it was nearly impossible to catch his gaze. Like I said, I wasn't in a huge rush but it got to the point where I almost went across the restaurant just to get him to grab my check. For that reason, I probably wouldn't recommend sitting down if you don't have a good chunk of time to kill.   Frustrations aside, I took a look at the small market setup on the way out which was a redeeming quality of 1897. They have locally made shirts, popcorns, sweets, and other goodies that are a step above what you'll find at other airport shops.   Chances are I'll be back at CLT very soon and would most likely come back. Next time, I'd probably take up the host's offer to sit closer to the bar for hopefully better service.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spinach mushroom pizza

fh1G5IU3X7-f7YXATJN1ww.text: 1897 Market. (3.5 stars).  Me: Hi, the sign outside says u have a raw bar here? Hostess: No, we don't, the bar does. This is a sit down restaurant. Me: OK, is the bar part of 1897?? Hostess: Yes, but u can't order raw bar items here. Go over there! *Rolling her eyes at me*  So as I was rudely shooed away from the hostess stand, I was tempted NOT to stop at 1897.  However, I'm glad I don't get terribly bothered by rude service because my order was extremely satisfying.  I wish HNL (Honolulu International Airport) could have food half as decent as 1897 Market!!!!  As I sat at the bar, I noticed that the bar has charging stations. Awesome since my phone was in need of a charge.  I was heading to New England & was ready for the last leg of my flight to be done. I was tired & hungry & definitely craving some oysters!!  As I perused the menu I decided on the following:  -Brava Potatoes -East Coast Oysters  Brava Potatoes - $3.99. (3 stars).  I didn't know exactly what to expect as I read the menu description:  "Crispy bliss potatoes, smoked paprika aioli, & herbs."  I love potatoes so I was excited to try this appetizer.  The potatoes were fried perfectly & seasoned with a sprinkle of seasoned salt. Addicting!  The smoked paprika aioli was tasty & packed full of flavor. The aioli was a bit too heavy on the mayo so I scraped most of the sauce off.  The only thing that I was not prepared for was the caramelized onions. Ack. They were mixed in with the aioli which made some potatoes inedible to me because the potatoes were swimming in onions & mayo.  For the price, this is still an appetizer I would order again. I would ask for the sauce on the side with less mayo & no onions!! Nonetheless a very good snack!  East Coast Oysters - $14.99 for 6 oysters. (4 stars).  I feel that these oysters were extremely fresh & plump.  Considering this is an airport restaurant & bar, I was pleased with the quality of these mollusks.  One thing that I wasn't expecting was the sprinkles of fresh cilantro. While I love cilantro, I felt it took away from the raw oyster flavors since cilantro is quite pungent.  After trying one oyster with the cilantro, I took the cilantro off the rest of my oysters so I could enjoy the oyster's natural briny flavor in all its glory.  These oysters come with cocktail sauce & mignonette but I just slurped them up without any sauce.  Definitely worth the price!!  ---  All in all, I'm happy I didn't let the hostess persuade me to leave.  The bartenders were extremely friendly.  I would come back to try 1897's burgers as my neighbor's burger looked juicy & delicious.  Oh how I wish we could get this kind of food choices at HNL!!!  Great place for a meal & drinks while transiting through CLT (Charlotte-Douglas International Airport).

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried perfectly.
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Surprisingly fresh!

rBGn3S8tJXivaouuKnoOoA.text: We all know great airport eats are few and far between. This place isn't top notch dining and by no means is it the best of airport food, but it's better than most. 1897 Market is huge and there are lots of options like seated dinner, grab and go, and communal tables to pound out some emails while you dine. There's plenty of options to please most adults and kids alike. I had a pizza last time and it was decent. Way better than a Sbarro or something. I requested a place to sit with an outlet to get charged up and it's great to have so many options. I had a couple hours to kill so I leisurely ate my food while getting some work done and charging my phone too.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Bronx

71ZNA5tyy0GmdAuYDaZ14w.text: Too many nots. Shrimp and grits were not among the the best I've had. Isn't this North Carolina? The shrimp were not very big, not very many and not very tasty. Also not a huge serving. I was still hungry after dinner.  Excellent beer selection.

bATnIkglHLokdotu9u5uvw.text: Ignore the weird/negative reviews!! THIS WAS SURPRISINGLY DELICIOUS!! Ask for Candy! I LOVE HER! She's so sweet & crazy fast! With great recommendations. I got the Neese burger and  farmer salad. NEESE BURGER WAS ONE OF BEST burgers I ever had in my life (I've been around, so I've had the best of the best)!!  Everything is fresh, farm to table. One of the first restaurants like that to ever be in an airport!

zGw8VRJ8hEftknGu0BYmOg.text: Airport food. You never really have high expectations for it, you're almost always expected to dish out more money than you would like, and for the love of all things holy you're still in an airport. 1897 Market is a restaurant/market? I don't really understand the practicality of the concept other than that during your meal...or before it..or after it..you can walk around their "marketplace" which is more like an upscale and overpriced convenience store. But i mean, all the dark wood furnishing! Certainly makes this Snapple tea extra appealing, right?! *heavy sarcasm*. But, hey. They have bar-like areas with LOTS of charging stations, so you can legitimately chill out here for a while for those 4 hour layovers (speaking from a personal experience). My brother and I got their burgers, medium rare. It was...like a 6 out of 10. Above average, not spectacular. I did appreciate that the fries on the side were obviously fresh out the fryer and decently crispy! The bro bro got a bloody mary that was too sweet for my liking but had a decent kick. Wouldn't come here again, but what airport restaurant would i come back to again? really.  The service was good, our waitress was attentive and kind. Also, by the end of the meal I was definitely full, so that's always nice My burger was $13+ and came with a side of (FRESH) french fries, and I think that's pretty fair...right? 3/5.

HZMMrEEcmNHx7c1aAq7iXg.text: We just had pretty awful food here.  Salad was dry and missing half of the ingredients listed on the menu.  The chicken was not even reheated.  It was cold, hard, and had the taste of left over chicken, so I did not eat it to avoid food born illness.  Pretty sure that isn't a safe way to prepare and serve food.

kHKYXxir8t0rX5NYX5QMnw.text: How confusing is this place? I think the multiple entrances is not a plus. Only one is staffed by a host. Nice choice of wine and while I didn't have one, the salads look fantastic. I had the meaty pizza, it was good but a bit doughy and undercooked. A great improvement from Chili's!

F5zATJnlUxfczYtWwT-uwg.text: Good bolognase. Food is delicious. Miranda is a very friendly server. Service was quick. Good stop to use time in the N.C airport

9GopM4sn9NUgx6ep5fKLUw.text: Typical airport joint. Don't let the facade fool you. Burger - uninspired. Fries - ice cold. Best thing I can say is that the beer prices are modest for an airport bar and they have local craft options.

g6b3kSSmafV45TiRTpZDkQ.text: Myself and a couple of colleagues had lunch here and the pizza was great.  We all also ordered Bloody Mary I would have to say it was worst I've ever had.  We didn't even finish the they were so bad.  For the 3 of us I paid $50 for the worst drinks. That was a rough. That's why it's a 3 star not higher.

3RRhR6Fg-bsxili8YfopgA.text: I had the Charlotte burger with parmesan fries. The meal was pretty tasty and the service was good.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Charlotte burger! Pretty good

ekmbjzitLcjgXI_7sYHXhg.text: I was heading over to eat here but wow! Two hostess standing at the front, just staring at the folks on the concourse with their arms crossed. Being the first ones to greet me, I was surprised at their cool demeanor. Maybe next time CLT... 6/7 at 10:15am in case management wants to do a little coaching

PN8gHVhWE3-bKLsyfE1xnQ.text: Don't get me wrong. I love the burgers in this place, especially the Neese. However $3.29 FOR AN ICED TEA IS HIGHWAY ROBBERY!  The operator, HMS host should be sanctioned for this, and I'll be passing that tidbit along to the airport authority.

9mOjXJJLUCGU5ScPfKcihQ.text: This place has the worst service. I fly through Charlotte often and was excited to find this place. A great menu and nice wine selection in an upscale feeling place. Each time I pass through I give it "one more chance". The food is good, if you don't mind being treated rudely by pretty much everyone you speak to, by all means, try this place out.

34ewF1eGakuqGdtUEBL3uQ.text: Burger was good and the pizza was great. Any pasta here is really weird and the flavors are off. The fries are a little under seasoned. Plus I had a small drink less than four ounces and the price was $16! Had I had know this, which the menu doesn't show a price too well, I would have gotten a beer somewhere else. Plus the dirty Mac and cheese is horrible!   Not a good place. Stick to sbarro.

GmtAdeNvMCS2r4jw0RlLgQ.text: Had a pretty mediocre cold and overcooked $14 burger here. Cold bun was particularly annoying. Service was great(quick) so not all bad but go somewhere else if you want a decent burger.

BR1_xHgcIqgHvIxfP4O5cA.text: The salmon was excellent and Karl's service was on point.  Easily the best meal I've had in an airport and the restaurant would do well in any market.

qZCa3Aa74ovcX7jrab0mnA.text: I have to give credit to 1897, I decided to try it out this morning after a late night cancelled flight and spending the rest of the night in the airport waiting to catch a morning flight.  I got the classic breakfast and substituted the home fries for grits and boy was I glad.  The grits were fabulous without my adding any extra seasoning.  Bacon was crisp and over easy eggs were cooked perfectly.   I'll definitely be back!

20bo46DjOvZsTC6D9LRBNg.text: Holy shrimp & grits Batman! That's all I have to say.  A bit pricey but what can you expect, it's an airport!

m6r9AcOukCXgvYMiCct3Bw.text: I hope the kitchen knows that there working in the Airport speed is a necessity. Imagine there were hardly NO people in the establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kitchen needs to get there act together..poor bartender has to walk back 6 times just to check on food..bad system.

yv6LzEmC8u_dvrG2pp0R0Q.text: After sitting waiting for 40 minutes after ordering and others eating their food that walked in before me, I had to walk out without eating my one meal for the day!  As a Consultant who flies as many as 198 times per year, I'll be banning this place and telling all my fellow consultants to nix this place as well!

jvkOEppibhCyWk1DSFGfew.text: We stopped in during a layover transfer. We ordered the Charlotte Burger and it was easily one of the best and juiciest burgers we ever had. It was amazing.  We were cutting it a little close on the timing. If we had a little more time, we wouldn't have had to be so rushed.   But definitely stop in for the burgers.

sZavPUF7_jYsnqZQlhQS4A.text: Good food with healthier options than other restaurants in CLT. Only disappointment was the hot water faucet that ran the entire time I sat at the bar. Mentioned it to the bartender and she didn't care. So wasteful.

n7tgLee51TfD_E-MsWxTAQ.text: 2 stars for the decor and service. Both were good. Food and coffee..don't waste your money.

moYHVogMGP_BcnosS2zswQ.text: Food seemed like it was premade and threw on a plate, room temperature. Service very slow.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Goat cheese sundried tomato omelette, better than the breakfast soggy oily bread thing

uDq04HU2T7RNX0vgY53rJw.text: I don't often have enough time for a sit down meal at airports but this holiday weekend I came insanely early. Security was quicker than I had feared, though, and I found myself with time for a real breakfast.  I couldn't have asked for a better place. A perfectly done omelet with sundried tomatoes and goat cheese, and some of the best bacon I have tasted. Service was quick and very genial. It's expensive, but I've paid as much in airports and gotten much less. They didn't refill the coffee and I didn't ask, didn't want to risk additional charge, but I am not going to let that minor objection keep me from giving the highest rating.

_cK72cH6ldMydAFx8LFdCg.text: I was in a rush packing. Packed some pasta for the flight but forgot the olive oil. After waiting in line for 10 minutes, I offered right up front to pay for some and they refused to sell me any.

L-V8gtU1qk26GpltcLdArg.text: We ate lunch here and ordered the burger and wreck roast beef sandwich.  Both were very good, and the accompanying parmesan fries were delicious!  The ambiance of the restaurant is very neat, and the staff is helpful, friendly, and fun.   The food is slightly overpriced, paying over $30 for two sandwiches (and only waters to drink), but it's at the airport so that seems typical.  We would eat here again.

VODBPTsxt0busoDZWDowrw.text: Excellent choice for an airport restaurant. There are a number of tasty, healthy choices for travelers.   My girlfriend and I ate in the dining room. We each had salads; both were delicious. Also, all of the ingredients tasted very fresh. Despite the fact that we were there near closing time, the quality of service was still solid--quick turnaround between ordering and food, responsive server, and numerous refills. Overall, it's everything you would want from an airport restaurant.

feVqb-N85OiMBU00mwImDQ.text: This is the best place to eat at CLT airport by far and have been here many times.  Great beer, good food.  I especially recommend the pizza and salmon salad.  However, this visit was a bit of a disappointment.  The burger ordered medium was well done with cold soggy fries.  Attempt number two resulted in a much better cooked burger to temp but lacked any real flavor, and the fries were still soggy.  The waitress may have been overwhelmed today but didn't even check to see how the recook was.  Better luck next time.

s3O0OK5pE8_U0kTyKFamOg.text: Had a super long layover, and decided to try it out. Had the sausage, egg, and harvarti and it was fantastic!  Should I ever be back in the Charlotte Airport, will definitely be coming back.

Uaglmwqrbqcab0oKWY4pHQ.text: Thank you so much! After 3 days of scant meals of cobbled together airport and conference food I finally had a fulfilling/satisfying meal!   Got here during a dinner rush so I waited a couple minutes in line before I was seated. Once seated, I was a bit concerned that I did not immediately see a server (I only had 40 min), but one soon emerged to take my order. The staff is quick here, not exactly warm/welcoming, but given the location, speed is preferred to hospitality!  I ordered a fabulous, but over-priced, glass of Malbec and the quinoa salmon salon. Both food and drink came out fast! I was so impressed with my salad! The salmon had a really nice crust and served over a bed of fresh and plentiful greens. I was also quite keen on the salad dressing, which was a walnut vinaigrette.   I will definitely be back here seeing as though it was my second favorite airport meal ever (first place goes to the delicious salad I had at Rick Bayless's place in the Atlanta airport).

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Can&#39;t believe I got to enjoy such a great meal at the airport! Salmon salad with walnut vinaigrette.

cYqyaedrcLVdJ6DSU7_pjg.text: Nice quality meal while waiting on a connecting flight.  Nice Fresh Onion Soup and Chicken Sandwich.  Great service even though Place was packed.  Also had outlets to charge devices.

GVcCB4QGlfSYpZh6TKq6ZQ.text: This is the first time I've given 5 stars to an airport restaurant. The spring salmon served over rosted root veggies, is amazing. A pleasant surprise during my layover. Kudos to Jessalee, my server, who handled the busy day like a pro.

f5ejdnoIz1quJzEAhAyY9Q.text: Went in for a dinner on an Airport layover.  Waited 10 minutes to order.  Then waited an additional 35 minutes for four-cheese pizza and macaroni and cheese with pulled pork - neither had any variation from the menu.  Both were served congealed and cold.  Neither item was even remotely edible.  DO NOT RECOMMEND.

hUQpvfaOz27_EH-oBfJouQ.text: Was pleasantly surprised at the quality of food.  Don't typically expect much from an airport restaurant, but food was great.  Got the grilled chicken truffle sandwich.  Subbed roasted veggies (which were beautiful radishes and carrots) and loved the truffle aioli.  A little pricey, but not more than you'd expect from an airport (and actually tasted like real food!) If you have some time to kill and need a meal I'd recommend

M8h_nrPS9Xb2B-gg5hefrQ.text: The service was good but we got the Dirty Mac & cheese and the first batch they brought out was cold and the crunchy topping was stale. We told the waitress and she brought a fresh one, no questions asked. However the second one, while warm, was still disappointing. The description on the menu said it had pulled pork but we could not find any.  I will not be returning.

V4Uj5cT_wYxok1iD3EX-Lg.text: Be sure to check out 1897 Market the next time you travel through Charlotte Douglas Int'l. Dining or quick carryout avaliable. They have craft beer, I was told locally made bourbon and other local products. We looked for the bourbon but later told by the server they were out of stock. The restaurant lost a star due to the temp of the fries. My wife ordered the blackened, grilled shrimp on sourdough bread slice with pickled onion, Arugula and a basil pesto spread. "Deeelicious"! I ordered the mushroom Swiss burger, cooked to a perfect juicy medium. However, the fries were not warm. Probably sat on the plate while waiting for the burger to get plated. I wish restaurants would figure out how to fix this. Cold fries happens way too much.  We both had a local craft beer. Excellent and not a bad deal for the 20 oz. pour.   The server caused the restaurant to lose a star because we were not provided enough napkins (one). What was worse, after she said she would be back, we eventually had to get up ourselves to get our own until she finally arrived to our table. I've seen some hit/miss reviews but we experienced a nice time and a great meal.

Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Casual lounge. Who needs airport clubs.
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1897 local market grabs.

B93hrtq3_2IdlyqNHZX56A.text: Came for breakfast on a layover. I ordered the Carolina Slam and my husband the turkey omelette. My meal had eggs that were hard on the bottom and still raw on the top. Not just the yolk, but the whites. It was also supposed to come with an arugula salad. Didn't get a salad. I would have mentioned it to the waitress but she disappeared after bringing ketchup for my husband. Someone else ran our check.   Maybe this place is better later in the day. But next time I'm in Charlotte I'll stick to Starbucks.

kHSaxRNo0wj0iPyFEaLKKA.text: Five stars for airport food. Got hand carved turkey. Tender and tasty and lots of . Side salad was big and good. All and all yummy  experience.

VmD2YThaow3kETAmU7mtGQ.text: First off: service was SO NICE. Over the top, very friendly and we couldn't have been happier.   This is a lovely addition to the CLT airport.   Breakfasts of veggie omelette and the Carolina slam were just what the doctor ordered, and lunch and dinner menus looked even better.   Can't wait to connect through CLT again!

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veggie omelette with big pieces of zucchini, squash and red peppers, with cheese and arugula. Home fries on the side. Yum!!

hyJU0KipP1lfss__1vJRuQ.text: Power at the bar.  Literally...the rest is pretty dull considering all the things they have going for them.  Good music, sports TV, hip decoration, fresh oysters and clams, and some good eats.  However, the staff is not fun or that friendly at the bar.  The Hostesses - all 3 of them - make you feel like you have 'arrived' - which in most cases, you just have!  Pizza was good.  Local beer recommendations were ok.  Sad that they have no BBQ on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Local pizza
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. I asked for a pint...this is what I got?

IbEYROjII-JQhGZTfRTWkQ.text: Notes: vegetarian, celiac.  After traveling through ATL airport recently and having an awful meal at Cafe Intermezzo, I was not thrilled with the idea of an airport restaurant salad.  But the Farmhouse Salad here was delicious.  I damn near licked the plate.  The Brava Potatoes were close to perfect.  I will stop here every time I fly through CLT.  Well done y'all.  Doing NC proud.

kPBruJWV_o9tFE-UkG9GIg.text: This restaurant has replaced the Chili's which had been in the Charlotte airport since time immemorial (at least ten years).  It is deceptively small looking, but can accommodate an enormous number of people due to a clever reconfiguration of the space.  The best item on the menu is the Denise's country burger, a mix of sausage and beef in one patty with cheese, bacon and "BBQ aioli" (yes, the hipster is strong at 1897).  Ingredients are fresher than expected in an airport restaurant, and the menu is sensibly restrained.  The kitchen seems to focus on doing a few things well, instead of trying to do everything at once, and for the most part they succeed.    If you are lucky enough to get Zack as your waiter the airport will be a little less burdensome.  He is very attentive.  As airport restaurants go, 1897 Market is at the head of the pack.

6TWMDjJ1M6V4uh0lbAjlWg.text: Now I remember why I've passed this place up the last couple times through the airport... This place is small enough to see from one end to the other, the dining room, and just about every server in the place....and STILL food comes out cold and any request (from coffee refill to hot sauce) takes forever as you watch your server do other things instead of knocking out your request.. I know this is an airport so expectations shouldn't be high, but a place called fresh market should work harder to live up to the name..

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Plates sitting under the lights for a long time - some more than 10min. Now I know why things come out cold and dried out..

_UNpYIk5Ag58w5lImw6HEQ.text: The Bloody Mary was pretty good though a bit more spicy than I like it. Mind you...I like spice but a good Mary doesn't need too much.  Do not get the BBQ shrimp and grits if you are from the south! They are acrid. The tomatoes are so acidic they turn your mouth against the remainder of the dish. Arugula is a garnish...remember that. The shrimp are really good and the grits on their own. The watery gravy they drown the dish in ya not needed or very good in the dish.  I was really hoping to enjoy this meal especially since I travel through the airport often! Oh well, I will not try it again. It is unfortunate there are other things that sound great on the menu. But so did the BBQ shrimp and grits. The hungry traveler!

Addh6HRQKPVwJsLHQ5DxBw.text: The food was good the service was good. We did have a small problem when we asked for a booth instead of a table. The lady that seated us said to wait by this booth while it was cleaned. The lady that was cleaning it said we could not be there and for us to go back up front. We did not as we was told to stand there.  Lots of traffic through this place but food came as ordered and in a good amount of time. This is not a place I would return as there are more places in the airport to eat.

zi3HxGMQZIhWjMZghJ25Gw.text: Oh my gosh!! This place is amazing!! I came to the market back in July and the restaurant, I went to about a year ago. Best food, great customer service! It actually has two sides to it. The market and the restaurant. The market is open early in the morning as well as the restaurant and the market is a little more laid back and is like a mini Whole Foods. From artisan food like their veggie frittata (yummy) to their organic foods and healthy snacks, they've got everything. They really thought well about the design and layout of the market and the restaurant from the tile design to the It has a nice country chic vibe! Very nice! 1897 is awesome! It has a rustic and classy feel. I love the beautiful decor with a brewery like feel. There is so much detail that went into it from the brick walls to the light fixtures to the wallpape, tiles, and the well-organized intersection of the market, deli and restaurant. Very nice!:) They even have something there for everyone and everything there is very healthy and delicious! So rare to find at airports! They have high quality meats, turmeric shots, and probiotics like Kevita! My kind of store! Their customer service is so good and the people there are so friendly! I have eaten at both the market and the restaurant and I had a good experience at both! Good food, friendly staff, and such a great place to unwind. :)

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nice atmosphere and views! :)
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Amazing decor and nice selection at market! :)
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Barn-like feel! :)

7nNRoepikLWWoz3rUaDs6g.text: Never in my wildest dreams would I have envisioned giving 4 stars to a restaurant in an American airport. I have obviously been spoiled by the great options available in foreign airports like Hong Kong, Singapore, Frankfurt to name just a few. Typically, American airports are crowded by fast food action or really mediocre quality full service establishments.  So today, much to my amazement, I was so pleasantly surprised when I dined at 1897.  The best airport food I have had in a very long time.  The Caesar was crispy, chilled and beautifully seasoned with an anchovy based dressing. The croutons were crunchy and crisp.  The chicken wings were uniquely prepared. They had been sauced, I surmise, prior to being cooked. Just sublime. They had a crispness to the bone and I really like that.  I have dinged them for sub-par service.  I could see that the wings sat at the kitchen counter for a while before the server picked them up. The young lady was friendly and charming but you gotta be on top of picking up the orders.  So, a pleasant experience overall.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. The wings.
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Caesar. Caesar would be proud. Maybe not Brutus!!

I8X7J5UghXA-1Zr2tRwMBw.text: Worst possible service. Was brought in and sat down at a table that was in the path of all of the other wait staff, plus it had incredibly uncomfortable seats. I asked politely to be moved and one of the staff cleaned off a dirty table and sat me down nearby on a bench seat. Where I sat for 15 minutes while others were brought in, sat down and immediately attended by a server. After the last time a server came to a nearby table and walked right by me and left, I bailed on this place asap. This is a freaking airport! You don't make people wait 15 minutes to order! This is a very unprofessional establishment for an airport and unfortunately is destined to fail. Do not support them unless they dramatically clean up their act. Beware.

UHISUBhYwBM0DFcXNbAKjg.text: Grabbed a beverage on the way to Boston. Service was great and the Bloody Mary was ON POINT! They used ZingZang mix and dressed it up so I was definitely a fan. The mimosa was generous with the Champagne too! Food looked great but I just didn't have time. Based on some of these reviews I will have to try to some grub on the next trip.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Saturday Travel Day Mimosa and Bloody Mary!

nrry_-hiUvwwVGwHIa2s3Q.text: I tried out 1897 Market on a recent layover at CLT airport.  I was grumpy and just wanted something to eat.  I tried the sushi place, but the line was too long for my 1 hr connection.  Getting increasingly frustrated, I stumbled into 1897 Market and was amazed by its size and great energy.  I was immediately seated and my waitress had my iced tea in under 5 min.  There is also grab and go seating for when it is crowded.  It is like a fully stocked c-store with a restaurant!  My mood suddenly started to lighten up!  I tried to be semi healthy and went with the carved turkey cobb.   This was an amazing salad!!!  It was loaded with some of the best turkey I can remember.  The sharp blue cheese, crispy bacon, egg and yummy croutons all mixed into a wonderful combination that was anything but an ordinary salad.  It was a big salad, but the tiny portion of iceberg lettuce reassured me that this was a healthy choice. The large menu contains sandwiches, salads, BBQ, mac and cheese along with some pretty good looking pizzas.    My server was really good!  She kept refills coming on iced tea and had a huge smile.  The whole experience was great from start to finish - I highly recommend 1897 Market!  This is my new go to spot when travelling to Charlotte Airport.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. What a salad!

DdwFLa-VaJuHqV-WHrDcMQ.text: The food was stellar. Took a long time to get to us. I get that we're in an airport and we may have time to linger, but I'd like to make that decision not have it made for me. Also eating in the airport already makes us at the mercy of what's provided. I just want it to be good and fast and well priced. Overall though the food and service were stellar. Lovey hostess and server.

MLWoPL7YGU9Ur8D1gn1o_g.text: Can't speak for the food because I have not gotten it. Looks like a great place but in an airport waiting for a bowl of soup and burger for over 35 minutes does not work. Ok. Food arrived. French onion soup was cold and cheese barely melted. Burger was ok. Nothing fantastic. Server nice enough. Took soup off bill. But would not come back here. Too bad. Looked like a good reprieve from usual airport food.  Update. Manger did come out without being asked for. Was really just trying to pay the bill and get going. But they comped it without any prompting. So maybe will try again.

zu3iMou39qqY-6zIWZjrTA.text: My review is just for the cookies available for purchase in the market area, which are definitely worth your time. Sweet Girl Cookies are a bright spot in the otherwise mediocre and sometimes terrible Charlotte airport food scene. The white chocolate cherry, chocolate chip and lemon blueberry white chocolate are all good. Like, worthy of a a quick run to the market or shop in terminal D during a layover, good.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States

lKfkaWNzeHpa-x7WQkkMJg.text: I admit, I had a terrible day of travel and I was super hungry but I loved the Bronze Bomber pizza. It's a pepperoni pizza but the crust is super thin and just cooked perfectly! A million people had flight delays and the airport was packed BUT my server, Raul, was on-the- Spot and the food was great. You have many choices at the Charlotte Airport - EAT HERE!

nmGullmUJ_H-1JTEUxVTnw.text: The 1897 Market happens to have a beautiful location located between A & B terminals.  Like most restaurant dining experiences in the airport, they won't care in the slightest that I'm writing this review, but I encourage you to vote with your feet and your wallet.  1897 Market's food is one of the highlights, in fact, as airport dining goes, they're probably in the top tier, at least for CLT (this ain't no ATL!).  The menu has a selection of pizzas and sandwiches, which come with some solid parmesan fries.  I particularly enjoyed their Truffle Chicken sandwich, which is both healthier and tasty.  Be aware, you can't pop in and out, but if you have a decent amount of connect time (40 minutes to board), then you can probably eat here.  That said, the food is good for an airport, and it's priced accordingly.  If you were to buy a chicken sandwich outside of here, you wouldn't be paying the $3-5 mark up.  So if you're money conscious, this isn't your place.  My experience with service here has also been mixed.  While I've had waitresses who are totally on point, I've also left irritated after 10 minutes of being seated, without getting so much as a greeting (and watching 5 other tables get seated, greeted, and their orders taken).  Service is the big component here, as the food isn't good enough to justify the price on its own.    Protip, if they ask you if you're ok with a high top, confirm with them whether it's communal and near their purchase in go area.  They are particularly terrible at figuring out how to service this area, and how to find a customer.

9r9pySVUVhkf9GIDUxvLcA.text: I've eaten here 2x the first was fantastic, service was great, the meal was great. However my review is based on the service on 9/28/17  Our service was very very poor. Melissa was our server she was not engaging, a bit rude and seemed rushed.   My background is in food service and it doesn't matter how busy you are the guest should NEVER feel that tension.   Melissa makes me question my repeat business...

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Farmhouse salad w/ shrimp &amp; oysters

jlxxfToBjwX8EhqlGi3JPw.text: I'm updating my review to reflect my experience at the 1897 Market bar. Bartender was fantastic and completely in the ball. She was great about making beer recommendations based on my taste, and let me try the beer before committing. I was so happy with her recommendation, and I was pleasantly surprised at the great variety of local Charlotte beers.  I also ordered the Truffle Chicken Sandwich.  VERY tasty. The grilled chicken was cooked perfectly, bread was fresh, but the best part was the aoli sauce on the sandwich. It was so flavorful with truffles and delicious. I splurged for the fries, which were yummy, crispy, and well seasons worth parmesan.  They have a few TVs, so it's a great place to stop and catch a game if you have a long layover!

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled chicken sandwich with truffle fries
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great that you can still sample a beer in a busy airport before you commit to a glass!

DppjyDCE6lM7srIr99rZTw.text: I hate airport layovers. Though the burgers at this place make them bearable. If you are stuck in Charlotte stop here.

IkKiKW0xyoReG4js8ymBaA.text: I had some time to kill at the Charlotte airport before a flight at 11 a couple weeks ago, so I looked around at basically all the restaurants in the airport before deciding to get a to-go order of the grit bake off their breakfast menu (to eat on the plane after boarding), as it looked the most interesting and the most filling. I'm really glad I got here before 10 (when breakfast ends), because their lunch menu absolutely looks just as overpriced as you would expect from an airport restaurant, but $11 for a good brunch dish is pretty much exactly in line with what I'd expect to pay at a nice brunch restaurant locally. They were completely willing to let me order only a to-go item, and even let me sit at the bar and not order anything for about 10 minutes while it was being prepared. And their bartender was so friendly, I even tipped her a little even though literally all she did was run my card and then hand me a bag (and I suppose let me use a space at her bar, but there was plenty of space, being 9 AM on a weekday.) And I ordered the eggs done over-medium (probably the hardest egg request), and got them back totally perfectly over-medium, just like I asked (yay!)  Food-wise, if it had been land-side, I'd give it a solid 4 stars. It was tasty and filling, and everything was clearly pretty fresh, but what I really wanted to try because it was so unique was the "bacon and tomato jam", and I couldn't really taste it over everything else. But it was still a pretty solid brunch offering, and given that I was at an *airport*, where the average restaurant is both overpriced and terrible most places, I was particularly impressed by that. And keep in mind - I ordered it at 9:30, walked around with it for a couple hours, and then ate it on a plane in the air a couple hours later, so it probably would've been even tastier if I'd eaten right when it came out. It was still pretty good when I had it, too, though, even at mostly room temperature by that point.

1VTaC_w79YMQr9PREQYS1A.text: Really good beer cheese soup. Along with my chicken Caesar bagel, it was a very comforting dinner

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States

WT7dTofq5B_irfYfoiSQTA.text: The chairs (both bar and restaurant table) are some of the most uncomfortable chairs I have ever sat in. It turns what could be a more enjoyable experience into an unpleasant one - but perhaps their goal is to make people uncomfortable to move on. Bar staff is not terribly attentive and it is not unusual to get the wrong order/bill. For an airport restaurant, very attractive. But you are better off going to the takeout side where the food is better and you can go sit somewhere else and be comfortable.

k6paPtzM2NZTudA5jQoCVQ.text: Worst customer service that I've ever experienced. Servers were rude and did not seem to want to help anyone. Tried to pay my bill and asked a server where I could pay and she was extremely rude.   I will not go here again and would not recommend it to anyone

WboSPYAOa5_oPe-WUAylCw.text: My goodness! Service is very bad. Layover from LAX, coffee sucks! Our food order was put in about an hr ago, no food. Flight leaves in 1/2 hr. I'll never return!  Manager was called, she was very pleasant, insisted we took food with us free of charge.

-iWYLoBOS6no8IzzXpVEzw.text: I'm reading reviews about "good for a quick bite".  There's nothing QUICK about this place.  I ordered a salad and after 30 minutes I had to go as I would miss my flight.  I've eaten here before and the food was pretty good but if you come give yourself plenty of time

5wiVHLw5TuPlE0_N2WDVVA.text: This place is pretty great! The employees are super friendly and very knowledgable. This location offers both a dine in area and also a market grab and go area! The food is very good, the beverage (alcohol) choices are great but very pricey if comparing different locations at the airport. It also has a lounge area in the back of the market. If offers a few couches and even more single chairs to just sit back and chill! Very home feeling, which is an awesome thing to have at the airport! Check it out, you won't be sorry! I'll definitely be back!
