tUqj_sz1SAbodNBMfL9XiA.text: Mediocre food, an attempt at a complex recipe with poor execution. Heavy flavorless sauces (gravies?) and poor quality products.  Crazy drink prices for unrefined cocktails served over crushed ice! Really? Although limited options at CLT, go elsewhere.

NQ6HyLBfGwbqLGuE2nQHrQ.text: This is my sons' favorite restaurant at the Charlotte airport. They really enjoy the pizza and the burgers. Their dad agrees it is a great place. In fact, we arrived early today just to eat here. The food is fresh and well prepared. Pizzas and burgers for kids. The boys like it so much they want to know if there are locations outside of airports.

nGk52cyeZZjBUqNHsvWQLA.text: I've been meaning to check this place out for a few trips so I made it a point to get to the airport with enough time for breakfast. The place was fairly empty and I feel like my service was fine so I'm not sure if they fixed the issues others had with long waits or if I just went at a good time. The breakfast menu looked good enough, but I wanted an omelet anyway.  I debated between the veggie and Turkey (it is nice to have more than one option that isn't pork).  I ordered the turkey and it came out in a timely fashion.  Since it was early I didn't check out their beer selection, but it sounds like I will have good options when I am back for dinner sometime.  Their prices are on par with airport prices but it seems like better food than Chili's Too had.  Bad Daddy's in C is a good spot for breakfast too, but I like to have more options near A since that is where I usually fly out of.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab pasta
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey omelet
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Power outlets with USB along the high top.

lcUifCKyKJliezZ-JnVqMg.text: Over priced and awful service. Took 40 minutes FOR A CEASAR SALAD (that I ended up cancelling). I watched people surrounding me get their food without even a look from the bartender working. Also- maybe it's my fault for not asking, but the "specialty drinks are poorly made, small, and don't have prices listed. They're starting at 16.00 if you're wondering... go anywhere else for food/drinks. Do yourself the favor and stay away especially if you're already upset with airline service/cancels.

_QmwwT67aLnf676QxvJClQ.text: And it was quite a good Turkey Salad!  The turkey was still warm, the lettuce crisp and the Blue Cheese dressing outstanding.  I have seen this location many times but didn't have time to try it.  Today the flight from Chicago was in 40 minutes early and beat the lunch crowd so I stopped.  And I am glad I did for the food.  But unfortunately the service was poor.  When I arrived they were not crowded but it took a while to get a menu from the waiter, Richard, and then another wait to place my order.   The meal came quickly, delivered by someone else.  And then I didn't see Richard again until 10 minutes after I finished.  Then I had to stare him down to get the bill so I could pay and leave to catch my next flight.  This poor level. of course lowered the overall score.  One thing I don't understand is why the trend started to pile all the ingredients separately around the the salad instead of distributing or mixing them over the entire salad so that you can get a combination of the flavors.  This trend bothers as much as the practice of piling the meat or fish on top of potatoes or something else.  I don't understand why they do it.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. That is a TURKEY SALAD!

K3taA8l93V2WRB4n1SRUnQ.text: By far one of the best airport restaurants in the world.  I travel extensively and 1897 market never disappoints.

K6wMKOkSBS93H_0D3ziG1g.text: When in an airport and need a drink

EkYoHbohUyAMw-1JStew9Q.text: Love the fact they would make a salad fresh and Allow  a substitution with a smile on their face - it's the old chili's over near Starbucks - I'll be back on Friday :)

vixqATtydM5Am9IVzMcTVw.text: Stopped here on a layover. Ordered their fries - outstanding and two glasses of wine. The service is good and quick. They close at 10, which was a bummer since my flight was later. Key point is at the bar they have tons of electrical outlets, which is super helpful in the airport.

chgD0aTWfsg68roXrcQH4g.text: I ordered the Farmers salad with radish, mixed greens, beets, goat cheese and granola was so tasty with the buttery Salmon. Waitress Candy was a pleasure and great with customer service. Nice atmosphere...Open kitchen for a good view of cooking and food prep.  Give it a try. I'll be back if I pass thru  Charlotte Airport, NC between gates B and C. Cheers!!

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. This Farmers salad with radish, mixed greens, beets and granola was so tasty with that buttery Salmon.

rmUJ9ucKNF1C9WCGpJa2GA.text: Great place and great food. This restaurant offers a welcome retreat from typical disappointing airport fare. The service was fast and friendly (thanks Raul)and the ambiance was nice too. Fun and funky decor, and creative and delicious dishes. I highly recommend the truffle chicken sandwich. Overall I would highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Truffle chicken sandwich (the other half that I didn&#39;t inhale yet) and Parmesan fries. So yummy!

difCVBAeXFC1KsphESq3Wg.text: Gah! What happened you guys?? You made me have to write my first 1 star!  I came here on Thursday 8/13 for a flight to Boston, and I wanted to take the Lady and have her experience what I experienced when I first came here (it was great, I was SO excited to come back and update to 5 star). We sat at the bar this time, and after sitting down, it took a couple of minutes for anybody to recognize that we were there. The waiter got us two waters, and the food menu.  We had been chatting with a couple next to us who had two sandwiches that looked tasty (one was a turkey sandwich, one a chicken with beets?) and they had highly recommended them. Well, after about 8 minutes of our waiter not giving anybody much attention, our order was finally taken.   Our waters were almost empty, but no water refills for us.   While that was happening, a man came up next to us and ordered a plate of little neck clams, as well as a chicken sandwich. He got his clams, which was a giant bowl of ice, and then four of the tiniest clams I've ever seen (both he and I agreed that we didn't know they could exist that small). He miraculously found the manager, told him about it (the manager was pretty speechless, but didn't really apologize), and got comp'd another plate of clams to make up for the first. These ones were just as small, but at least it was the amount of food he bargained for.  Still no food for us, no water refills for us.  A couple of minutes later, he received his chicken sandwich, which he took one bite of, and then tapped the top bun on the counter... *DINK DINK DINK* it was rock solid. He also said his fries were ice cold.   Still no food, no water refills.  We asked our original waiter if he could see where in the heck our sandwiches were. He went to the back. Didn't see him again.  After about 5 or so minutes of waiting, we got fed up, told the manager everything we'd been through, STILL no water or food, and we left. Miffed that we wasted that much time before our flight on nothingness.  We're lucky that we didn't pay anything; they will not be receiving our service again.

sL3ZYGfO_L9UfIVpYNBxyQ.text: Having a three hour layover, I simply had to have a sit down restaurant. The menu is pricy but has eclectic choices that all sounded pretty good. I got shrimp on toast with brava potatoes. While there were only three shrimp, it was off the appetizer menu, so that's okay. The salad on the shrimp toast was quite fresh and yummy. The potatoes were slightly sauced with something but good as well. I got quick and efficient service. I'll eat here again when time is appropriate.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brava Potatoes
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp on Toast

UP4NMS4zEGw89gswsVLwhg.text: This apparently took over the space where Chilis Too used to be in the airport.  I sat the bar, and did my normal waiting for my flight....  and decided to catch some lunch.  Great food, a bit on the pricey end but what isn't in the airport.  Very few places show up with raw oysters too, which this place had if that was your poison while you waited for your flight.  They had three TVs up, but it was more like 2 since one was situated behind a support beam which was unfortunate.   This setup could be a bit better for Sunday football season.   Just saying.  They had great beers on tap, and i ordered myself a Shocktop draft.   I also got a roast beef sandwich called the "Southern Wreck" which was to die for.  Amazing.  It was like a French dip, but I believe it had way better cheese melted, and some other goodies in it.  Let me put it this way... I didn't want to put it down, and when it was gone, I was wondering if I should order another one just for the hell of it.  Great place and it wraps around the gift shop area.  I'd be curious if they take in enough money to keep the place packed, but it seemed like it was pretty full the entire afternoon I was there while waiting for my my flight back home.   I have to say that if you have some time to kill at Charlotte International?   See if you're able to stop by the 1897.

_EgqitWkyGi4XhjQA22n5Q.text: As I was being led back to my table, I marvelled at how much it seemed to remove you from the feeling of being at an airport (if you overlook the luggage next to every person). Just 3 steps past the hostess booth, you are immersed in noise from conversations, HVAC, radio music and the grill stations. The [Knob Creek] Old Fashioned that I sipped while I waited for my order was smooth but lacked an actual cherry (which I was hoping for based on the description - unless the pulp at the bottom was it?!). Word of warning, it also cost more than my meal!! She did not ask if I wanted water and it was not provided by default. Despite (or because of) the menu warnings about undercooked meat, I wasn't asked my opinion about how I wanted my 'Neese Country Burger cooked, although I wonder if it would have made a difference. The patty seemed fried rather than grilled, although the overall burger wasn't dry. The cheese was a nice flavor, and I may not have been as happy with the burger if I had opted out. The fries were crispy [to a fault some might say, but better that than soggy!], but otherwise unremarkable. For a busy restaurant, the waitress often asked how I was doing as she passed. Nearby, a manager appeared to be attending a customer complaint, with follow up by the waitress. At the end of the meal, I am torn between giving it 3 or 4 stars, due to price, location, quality and service. I'm going to settle on 4 stars because I was not inconvenienced by any delays and also with the hope that they will always strive to improve.

lIi8rY_att6oFpBGZmxpeg.text: Not very wild about the lunch I had there--a chicken sandwich basically, that was far too salty and not fresh-tasting. And overpriced. That's a given at an airport but I just wasn't pleased with the meal.

JqeHKJu2bAvfJLrqxw-NBA.text: Pleasantly satisfied with my breakfast here. Especially considering this is an airport institution and I'm not at the airport to eat, I would happily come here again.  - Tasty, solid food: Mostly "classics" and relatively simple ingredients. Nothing unusual or innovative, but the food tastes good. I had the open faced sandwich. - Quick, moderately priced meal: From order to delivery of food took just 10 minutes. Granted, this was breakfast and not peak time. Prices are acceptable.  - Relaxing atmosphere: If you have a long stopover, this is a wonderful place to sit and enjoy and meal or beverage. Happy, country chic vibe. Forget you are in the airport.  - Accommodating service: Servers and hostess are friendly and did not rush me. Have to ask for things (e.g., water, knife, etc.) and maybe more than once before it is delivered, which may be frustrating for some.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Open faced sandwich - egg, sausage, tomato, cheese (breakfast item served until 10:00 AM).

ZL0CDDjoFLvKUwdD-N32cA.text: Great stop in the airport for breakfast. The service is quick.  The food is fresh.  I ordered a veggie egg white omelet.  The potatoes were really good as well.  Coffee was strong and better than Starbucks in my opinion.  I would definitely stop there again when traveling.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States

igx1ZV7EhvPDTpJLZpzNMg.text: This breakfast completely exceeded my expectations. I really wasn't expecting to enjoy food in an airport but this was excellent and the portion was very generous. The toast was sourdough bread. The hash browns were real thick cut potatoes and the star of the plate was the bacon. It was thick cut and just very slightly sweet. It was crispy and perfectly cooked. It made my airport layover in Charlotte very pleasant. Cute place too!

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. 2 eggs scrambled, bacon, hash browns, &amp; toast

A7fuvjN9lLsH85lwf4c5Qw.text: What a joke. This place appears to be beautiful and professional from the exterior but they do say "don't judge a book by its cover." Unless you've got four hours until you board your flight, you're better off eating questionable sushi in the NC airport. It took an hour for my husband and I to get a salad and a chicken sandwich... during this hour, four separate tables walked away without either being asked to order or receiving their food. When it arrives, it's alright, nothing to be excited about, and definitely NOT worth the hour wait. When I asked for ketchup, fifteen minutes went by, and I got up and asked someone for it and found five employees standing around in the wait station chatting while customers walked away from their tables. Again, what a joke.

4ibmGyn4NrYnybSxZDEMJQ.text: Horrible service.  They did not really even seem to be too concerned it was horrible no apology.  I asked a couple of times about my food and how much longer it would take and they never came back with an answer after walking by me a number of times.  I finally just got up and left.  I really thought it was going to be good it appeared to be so cute but I guess looks are deceiving.

cxYYVn_xgeANA56OZR476w.text: I appreciated 1897 Market because, when you're stuck eating at an airport, food options tend to be limited, and are normally insanely repetitive and uncreative in nearly every airport one travels through (think Sbarro pizza, McDonalds, Cinnabon, etc.).  Here at Charlotte airport they do have a handful of more unique and creative food and drink options vs. many other airports, and on my most recent layover here I was happy to find this place, the 1897 Market.  This venue offers several options, everything from a full "be seated by a hostess and be served" restaurant experience, to a made to order pizza bar, to another area where they have a display cooler for those who just want to grab a sandwich, salad or other cold foods and drinks to go, or to quickly enjoy here.  They have an interesting seating area for the people who get the "to go" items, which is laid out more like a cozy and rustic living room with couches, comfy seating and a large flat screen TV on the wall.  Otherwise, to go customers are banished to a set of high tables with stools (and power connections for laptops, phones and other devices), but "to go" customers are reminded that they are not to sit at any of the low tables with chairs, as those are only for customers who are here for full restaurant service.  Prices aren't horrible, I had a rather large and filling cobb salad for $9 and a bottle of Vitamin Water for $4.

PA27MlSx_XEc2rIXeR9hoQ.text: I didn't know what to expect so I came in to give 1897 a try. I was served up by the most friendly server Karl. A True professional . Quick to check in on my needs. Great selection of craft beers on tap. Had a few 7.2% Noda brewing-hop, drop N Roll IPA. Wow caught a quick buzz for sure. I had the southern wreck- roast beef, caramelized onion,queen Charlotte Blue Pimento, Dijon aioli served in a fresh baguette. Food was tasty . The highlight was the buzz of course and the great 60's 70's music playing while waiting for my flight . Oh and the food was good too.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States

TPOXuhdB1Wdxni7_Syjqhw.text: Had the turkey sandwich and it was pretty good. Turkey tasted delicious and the ingredients were fresh. Would have liked a little bit more salt on my fries.  Not a bad option for airport food. I would definitely go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey sandwich

d9I02AU-yltD5ob1TyBOhg.text: Came here for breakfast and when I got my bill to discover a bottle of water is 4.49. This place should be ashamed, total rip off for me.

1OmIwJYs9Ydo2p4qStPqJQ.text: Stopped in for breakfast in my way out of town. The place is rather large, serves alcohol, has a sit down restaurant and also has to-go snacks. The veggie eggwhite omelette was served with grilled zucchini and squash! Not your typical omelette. Perched on top of the omelette was arugula amd it was accompanied by a nice serving of crispy potatoea.  My only complaint if they used too much butter on the omelette.  I received 3 half pieces of toast  (kinda weird). The tables were set with napkins and only a fork, so I had to ask for a knife...again kinda weird. The server was pleasant.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States

nlo_YsebKMFbri7ZL7_7cA.text: Step into this market with various spaces, exposed brick and open floor plan - you will be transported into a relaxed environment that will allow you to completely forget you are in an airport. There is a bar out front, plenty of tables inside, a number of booths, many high-chair counters with charging stations and even a lounge with plush seating.  The food clearly is an attraction with a raw bar, handmade pizzas and lots of southern favorites, but what prompted this review was their impressive lineup of spirits and craft beer. Local favorites NoDa and Birdsong are available both on tap and in a cooler to-go, plus you can get options from around NC like Duck Rabbit, Foothills, Catawba and Lonerider. Carolina Ale House over at the end of Concourse C may have Carolina Blonde on tap, but this place has a better variety and much more appealing atmosphere.  This place would get plenty of business even if it were not in an airport, so next time you have 30 minutes or more with a layover, make your way to 1897 Market for something delicious.

n3-x6I3nikqP-GpMhppJQg.text: Dang this place is expensive.... I wanted a cocktail, but could not justify 17$... yikes. Regardless, I got the mac and cheese.... it was heaven! So creamy and studded with pork product. Yum. I also got the fries (since so many said it was fabulous)...they really were nothing special. If you go, stick to the mac and cheese.

wehs6S2AItlK8TrRe82Acw.text: Terrible service, wrong appetizer order, lukewarm soup. Wings were good though. Will not be back.

SCIyIq_WcyIPHnDqFntxHQ.text: UPDATE. The Food & Beverage Mgr. immediately reached out toys and sincerely apologized! Class act all the way. Stated that waitress should have informed me that drinks are "doubles". (She didn't). In any event this is what makes good companies great. Awesome management. They refunded the charge and have proven that some companies actually care. Very Impressive. I'll be back. We"re still trying to shake off the violative feeling we experienced after a lay-over at Charlotte International Airport and are not recommending anyone visit the 1897 Market. Wife and I were looking for a salad and a quick drink. We chose the mixed greens salad with Walnut vinegarette dressing and the side of breast of chicken $15.98 per salad....a bit pricey, but the salad was fresh and we wanted healthy. Wife and I decided on a Bloody Mary- spicy. Well we had no idea the real spice would be served with our bill! Our very friendly and capable waiteress Brittney delivered unto us a whopping bill for $64.89 for 2 salads, and 2 bloody Mary's. Suffice to say we were completely sticker shocked! Not something we're often accused of being--as we gladly pay for either quality, service or hopefully -- both, and tip handsomely when we encounter such. When questioned our friendly waitress was left to explain the exorbinate rate for two very nominal drinks as " the airport sets what we can charge". Huh? Perhaps next time she takes an order for one shot of vodka and some tomatoe juice she should--in the best interest of the consumer, disclose their price of $13.99 !! This restaurant was nominal at best, and I saw two tables leave in my short time there due to an inattentive wait staff, Nevertheless, despite my belief that the "airport" should cover her tip -- I still tipped her 16% as I'm not content penalizing a young lady for her employer's greed. I would urge ALL TRAVELERS to avoid the 1897 Market at ALL COSTS. Save your money this place is a rip off factory. Understanding prices will be higher in airports is part of the game---gratuitously profiteering is just plain and simple greed and trickery. The parent company HMS Host ( customerservice@hmshost....) will be hearing from us next! In the meantime take your business elsewhere HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE.

hKB8bs9_arj0QaNCP9_enQ.text: Looks good. Doesn't deliver. After waiting an interminable time, my turkey sandwich was delivered. People who arrived after me got their salads before me. So, pass this one by if you only have a fairly brief time for a meal. No Malt vinegar for what look like good fries.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Looks good. Not worth the long wait though.

LXQR_hJ5OD4lpZBKkbEV0A.text: I stopped here because i wanted something fresh and healthy but quick before a flight. From a food standpoint this was hands down delicious! I had a salmon salad and everything included was delicious and in the right amount. What was included with my meal, i could have done without. The hostesses were rude, disrespectful, cursed under their breath, at one point i heard a hostess say "omg if they don't hurry the hell up" as she was escorting 4 elderly patrons to their table. The saving grace of their staff was my server, Trent. He was polite, gracious, and appeared to enjoy his job. I'd suggest ordering food to go here, and enjoying it in an atmosphere that is much more about hospitality. And yes, even in an airport you can have hospitality

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States

kA7x36_Jq92ZVYo5VpOzow.text: If you find yourself in the Charlotte airport--hungry for a great burger and a beer--stop by 1897 and try Neese's Country Burger (Angus beef ground with local sausage topped with bacon and a fried egg) It's good!

PEt-eOFkrEorvJdv9zV2hA.text: Happy I found this casual restaurant for lunch.  Good food & drink & pleasant atmosphere between flights. Not rushed to turn over tables and friendly wait staff. Nice!

yZJOrc8ypNVqySpozdem7A.text: I have only eaten here for breakfast. I have never been disappointed with their breakfast. I usually get an omelette and substitute the home fries that come with it for grilled tomatoes. They have decent coffee. The service is always courteous, but sometimes it takes a little long. Prices are right, especially for an airport. The restaurant is large and nicely decorated, with an area to grab food to go, and a small market.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spinach and mushroom omelette with grilled tomatoes as a substitution for the home fries

tYkFGBswaKjcX8ZUUZ08ug.text: Had a delay with my flight and decided to stop here for some grub. I'd been here before and the food was unexceptional, but it came fast with good service. Not this time.   I sat and waited for almost 20 minutes for my server to arrive at my table. She apologized profusely, and really no harm done. Everything from that point with her was delayed, entered incorrectly, or she just forgot what I asked for (like my drink and then a refill).   Food was meh. I ordered a burger with bacon, which came out severely over cooked and barely warm to the touch, a side salad and a side of fries. All the plates came out with grease smeared on the plates from dirty gloves and even my drink had, what I hope was, iced tea grounds.   There are a lot of other options at this airport. I'll likely shop here at the market, but I won't be sitting for a full serve meal in the future.

5NwZL6qvIagNWarkyKx0Kw.text: A 'better than most' place to eat in the Charolette Airport. We got some time to sit, have coffee and breakfast. About that....  I didn't take any pictures this time, basically an omelette is an omelette is an omelette. Our waitress was fast and attentive, the coffee wasn't bad and nice and hot. I had the spinach and mushroom omelette and Momma K had the farm breakfast.  The eggs were heavy, the arugula and mushrooms were fresh. Same for MommaK.  Bottom Line: If you have to eat in an airport, this is a pretty decent choice.

m4jN1KZ5Dif9O3s69NzkPQ.text: Updating my review and giving that final fifth star thanks to Marvin, the manager on duty last Wednesday. He was amazing. My server Jessica was great but struggling with the kitchen to get my personal pizza out. Marvin to the rescue. He made it happen; came over to personally apologize and explain the situation and then checked back in later to ensure all was good. He's amazing!   Positive experience all the way around. Immediately greeted and seated with a smile. Our server Ryan was fantastic! She was friendly, she was efficient, the orders were accurate, and she was available but not hovering too much.  The food was good. The burger was tasty and well prepared and the pretzel bun it was on was fantastic. I had a side salad instead of fries and it too was good and actually a nice size. The wine is a bit pricey but otherwise no complaints! Ryan made the experience awesome!

OXww53iHtDvdVsYM8FAi8w.text: Sandwiches are OK, you can get them fresh made or recent vintage. I kinda prefer one from the display case for the same reason I buy cars off the lot: I can see how it looks. They do a respectable Reuben w/ russian dressing or the chunky chicken salad if you want to eat less poorly. Chicken pesto pizza is quite good (the price simulates a delivery charge to the airport.) Crust is light and flaky around the edge and cooked through in the middle despite the abundance of veggies on top. Light and flavory but a dash of hot sauce helps it breathe and grated parmesan would be a nice touch. Regardless, it pairs well with Capt Jack ;-)

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. breakfast of champions plus 1/2 a chicken salad sandwich

k19qjc2bvKGXp4lstH1bPg.text: WAY TOO OVERPRICED. SUPER BLANDE FOOD.   Was intrigued by the nice design of the place as well as the good reviews on Yelp. I decided to visit for lunch and ordered a pizza. I ordered a vegetable pizza with chicken. IT WAS $20. The five small pieces of chicken breast I got on my pizza was FIVR DOLLARS?!!?? Is this some sick joke!!???  Further, the pizza was so bland. There was literally no taste to the pizza other than spinach. There wasn't even any salt or pepper.   I had to wait like 30 minutes for my small pizza as well. Just awful. Would not recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veggie pizza with grilled chicken

vnaEKxFrozCOcI4G7UUkkw.text: Fantastic little spot.  1897 Market is a deli/cafe type restaurant, they have a nice variety of deli foods from brick oven pizzas, sandwiches, salads, coffee, desserts and more.  I had their cobb salad which was fresh, and delicious.  The ingredients were of high caliber and not cheaper deli meats you sometimes find.  The service is awesome.  They're extremely quick and efficient, and the staff are very friendly and polite.  The restaurant itself is centrally located in CLT with easy access from all terminals.  It has a clean, open and airy feel to it but does tend to get busy during peak times, though there is plenty of table, hightop and bar style seating available.  It always feels a bit pricey, but which airport store/deli/restaurant doesn't?  Regardless, this wasn't my first visit and won't be my last.  The food is great, awesome service, and very convenient.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cobb Salad
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cobb Salad
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States

d1L5AUZrpWLjxb86jLCkgQ.text: This spot is great for stopping in for a quick bite and a beer before a flight. My husband and I have only visited the grab and go section and we enjoyed the selection of local craft brews. The pizzas are decent for quiz airport food and as expensive as you would expect in an airport. We will continue to relax here when we are not in the new terminal A section where NoDa Brewing is.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken pesto pizza

raKW_fqiLaWoNeXa8MlKjQ.text: As far as airport food goes, this place isn't bad. I got Neese's country burger with a side salad. Since it had sausage in it, you couldn't choose how you wanted it cooked. It ended up being pretty good and flavorful.   My biggest complaint is that the service was really bad. It was really slow which isn't ideal for the airport. My server never came by to refill my water and after I was done eating I couldn't find anyone for quite a while to ask for my check.   All in all, if you have enough time, this is a good place to stop for a bite to eat at the airport.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Side salad
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Neese&#39;s country burger (no bun)

TIYpv2Wuya8TbGHbQ2ly-A.text: If you have plenty of time on your hands and want a sit down to a fresh cooked meal, the market is a good place to kill some time. They offer pretty generic offerings sandwiches, raw bar, but also a few specialty entrees.  Bucatini with bacon jam - too sour, found no trace of bacon, but it's nice to find bucatini on the menu. Southern wrecker - artisanal philly cheese steak with no flavor Brussel sprouts - bitter and big  I must be ordering the wrong things on the menu. The burgers look good though. Seating wraps around the back and they also offer an actual marketplace to buy snacks and on the go sandwiches and salads. Live music in the evenings.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Southern wrecker - $13.99 for a Philly cheese steak on fancy bread
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bucatini with bacon jam and a side of Brussels sprouts

QLRpS-lYhWFMXst0lk7law.text: Girls & guys, guys & girls.. open your ears and wipe your eyes. This is going to be brutal but NOT brut, because they didn't even have champagne. These are the 9 reasons NOT to dine at 1897: 1. The service does not know the menu or the price of cocktails 2. The chicken tenders did not come laminated 3. It took over an hour to prepare 3 chicken tenders and one salmon salad... we MISSED our flight!!! 4. We ordered a 9 ounce wine, measured it... it was 6 OUNCES. ? 5. The side order of fries came with a total of 5 fries. 6. The Moscow mule was not from Moscow. Not copper. WRONG. 7. The straws in the mule glass also only went halfway down the glass, so I was forced to tip the glass into my mouth and it spilled everywhere. 8. The waiter left us alone for so long we thought he hopped onto a flight. 9. They didn't offer our service animal @pop24carrot any water and she was clearly dehydrated.

gFiFQE996xSFCo3bkAwriw.text: Solid airport restaurant. They have a full service sit down restaurant and a grab and go. We were there on a Friday night and they had a live music which was nice to experience. They have a ton of can craft beer. I have only done the grab and go items the salads are pretty good and so is the pizza. It is a nice option for food other than the typical fast food chains.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Live music

gOJwCsRJJNUzahb-7prgIA.text: This place is kind of just a front for a place to over charge for mediocre product. Currently the Asian woman behind the bar believes she not only do a poor job tending but also entitle herself to tips solely because she's mildly attractive.

insBjMwkr21CHO1Y3l1lyg.text: So the place is in an airport and prices are high - duh! But the food is very good. I do not fly often, but on my most recent trip, I discovered this upscale restaurant and one in Philadelphia.  In this review you will find my comments on the food I ate, the menu offerings and the unique overall concept.  Steak Frites was my choice and i was pleased with the strip steak and fries. The onion sauce with the steak was very nice and complimented the meat perfectly. When the server asked how I liked it, I said, "as rare as you can legally cook it." That is exactly what I got. Aged beef it was not, but it was much better than the lower end steak restaurants offer. I liked it. It was a tad tough, but very flavorful.   French fries were very good, but the batch I got was inconsistent. One fry would be perfect. The next one was crunchy as a shoe string potato, while a third may be soggy.  Menu offerings were varied. You could get steak house type meals, burgers, sandwiches, pizza, oysters, salads, etc. Odd thing, though - There were only four varieties of each.  The place was a combination of upscale restaurant, sports bar, pizzeria, oyster bar, grab and go deli, and a shop with different food items.   A fun place. Check it out.

zN2G5qnasoeeVwQTHEnfXQ.text: Ordered the french onion soup, Charlotte Burger and the Spinach mushroom pizza.  The french soup was good but contained no onion. The burger was good too but the frys were awful. All of the pictures show a thinner cut fry but these were steak frys. (Straight opinion on that). The pizza was below average. I got the pizza because there were alot of positive reviews but it was far from that. "Tasteless" is really the right word for it. They need a better cheese or something to really give it flavor. Oh, and you better like mushrooms because it's LOADED with them.  Service started off good but ended bad. We were the farthest table from the front and honestly just thought forgotten about. I had to go ask for a spoon. My wife had to walk to someone to ask to check us out so we could leave. No pickles with the burger even after I ordered extra pickles. Would have told my server but she was no where to be found.   I'm giving this place 3 stars solely because the burger was good.  Good ice too with the water.

jq0z1b5W1Kc9TcL_hMnPYQ.text: While on a 2-hour layover in Charlotte, one of my friends recommended 1897 Market as my lunch spot. They have a pick up and go part of the restaurant and a sit-down area. Since I had so much time, I opted to sit down and enjoy my food. I ordered the carved turkey breast sandwich on a pretzel roll since they ran out of sourdough bread (what the sandwich is normally on). The turkey breast wasn't your typical deli-sliced turkey. The turkey was a thick piece of meat that was slightly dry but otherwise well-seasoned and accompanied by havarti cheese, lettuce, and tomato. The sandwich was incredibly filling and was served with standard fries. Overall, it was a good meal. Though a tad bit pricey, I would be back for some nice fresher food at the airport.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States

vkaS2I6SwI623Ku8GZztTQ.text: Love love loved my meal from here! Super quick service to get a seat (they have a huge seating area), and it was only a couple minutes until I got my trout. The menu was pretty vast and saw a lot of people enjoying different dishes around me. I'm not a huge trout fan but I absolutely loved the trout and the sauce, as well as the Brussels sprouts underneath. Huge portion as well, had enough for my lunch the next day. A little pricey, but great quality and if I ever stop in Charlotte again I'd for sure come here.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Trout with Brussels sprouts

swL7_vGRjdml_2RABim6jA.text: 10:05 am and they don't serve breakfast? Lunch only? Come on. Just don't open your kitchen until noon then.  A joke.

x84QjrHu3SBxgT0-FpzgZQ.text: Great restaurant in an airport with real food cooked right in front of your eyes.   I tried the burger with bacon and pimento cheese. Oh goodness it was tasty. It had a nice char on the beef patty and crispy bacon with lots of yummy pimento cheese.   I wish I would have went with the salad, like the one I saw sitting at my neighbors plate. Instead I tried the French fries that were fine but kinda soggy.   Glad to have found this place in the airport, that makes you feel like you're not in an airport.

9rP6Rl0Nb2DExUwepPeFjw.text: At the sit-down area Friday evening , I ordered the seared salmon " well done...crispy". I don't care if the traditional way to cook salmon is warm outside with an uncooked middle. I asked for well done. It came to me not close to well done....barely warm in the middle. The server told me, " sorry I don't have a knife for you they're being washed ". No knife ever showed up.

POopyLht9FDXOqhlhgGw-Q.text: I like the food and the place but they just miss the fact that you are in an airport with tight schedule.

5LlYvfDd_xYYXt2EnBoYdg.text: GREAT place to grab a quick bite and spend some quiet time before heading into town. It is especially handy after an early morning a.k.a Red Eye flight. Hot breakfast and hot drinks of Illy brand coffee and tea is waiting for you. Good choices of Breakfast, and other choices to grab and go if you're in a hurry.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. An eclectic breakfast of Frittata, donut, and coffee.
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Frittata for Breakfast.
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Entrance to the Market. It is best right after a Red Eye flight because it is quiet.

0aHUIy8-ZQBGz0KjtrW2-A.text: Charlotte burger was right in point. Not very juicy and not dry at all!  Gayla was a great waitress! lol

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Charlotte burger right on point!

2xSZ61RFZXcs5j-laF3wmA.text: Had a classic southern burger exactly what I wanted very  Good! Cooked perfect . Yummy after a long flight  Jaycee had barbecue shrimp and grits !  I never got to taste !  She ate it  before I could taste it  Spicy between 1-10  she said a 7 . Great service too !

1WdqI2ReUKRdIAi2eAjNkg.text: Nothing like paying $15 for a salad with wilted lettuce. I love not getting when I was robbed on the price. Don't eat here they may serve you old stinky meat, cook it and pass it off as fresh!

005rw2IDmB8kIN9XWEeHmA.text: I will be honest, I was very excited to see a "farm to table" restaurant pop up at the Charlotte airport. Finally something better than Wendy's and Starbucks! I really wanted to like this restaurant but sadly it just did not live up to expectations.   First waitstaff was great, very friendly and warm. They gave a True representation of southern hospitality and service.   However once the food came out I was greatly disappointed. I came in for breakfast and ordered the Carolina scrambler. It promised, cheese grits, bacon, biscuit and eggs and an arugula salad tossed in a Tabasco vinaigrette. Bacon came out soggy and soft and the vinaigrette was missing. Staff was accommodating and brought the vinaigrette on the side but by the time I got it my eggs and grits were cold.   I believe this place could be better if the cook staff paid better attention to their plates and ensured each plate came out to southern standards.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carolina scrambler

l5MtdveX5xrypSOrRHX-XA.text: Pretty decent place for the Charlotte airport. Picked up a nice ham sandwich to go for my flight. But noticed they were cooking up lots of fresh items, and like how they laid out the restaurant with many great options.

DrIP-bkvC6vU7hKA8qHQXQ.text: Very good service! Had breakfast, it was decent nothing special. It was just eggs, bacon , toast.  Wanted to try their grits , but it was 7:30am so wanted just plan breakfast. If I stop by here again I would definitely try the other items on the menu.

8NnvxPm3GqYD34I4KW6--A.text: Food is well below average even for an airport..... much better options in the terminal. The restaurant looks very nice, but that's where the good ends, from here it's bland food, which is luke warm with little taste.... this is my second try, and final attempt.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States

PWCmY7dVNd6THo4Sa4j0QQ.text: Ok.... decided to stop here during a long layover in Charlotte. The food was really good and my mai tai was a gift from the heavens.  Our server was on point and his recommendations for food and drink were great.  It was a pleasant laidback atmosphere  to recharge your phone,  chat with your travel mate and people watch.  Even chatted with a few follow travelers. Now back to this heaven in a glass drink I had.  This was the best mai tai I ever had.  I did give me a light buzz so it was not missing the alcohol but so good you really didn't taste the alcohol. Hats off to the bartender. Think my husband was trying to get me drunk as he wanted to order me another.  Had to say no because if I did he would have been carrying me and my carry to our flight gate.  They are not scared with the prices but what decent airport restaurant isn't. Hope for another layover in Charlotte thanks  1897 market

q8tROkhjyS0aV4kGjQIITQ.text: Funny...people bitching about airport restaurants, prices and service.  Airports are airports...lots of hustle 'n bustle.  I've been in airports and had little time to grab a plastic boxed sandwich between flights and I've been in airports for hours and hours - enough time to drink way too many beers.   It's an A-I-R-P-O-R-T!  Hint, hint...  1897 Market?  Pretty good - better than average in my not-so-humble opinion.  Lots of food selections, drinks galore...all delivered with quick and (somewhat attentive) service.  I made it through security :30 minutes ahead of my traveling companion and was able to sit, order and drain a beer before he arrived.  The waiter made sure I had what I needed quickly and with a smile.  When my associate arrived, menus and brews showed up quickly.    The food was quite decent.  No, it wasn't "other-worldly," but it was good.    Bottom line: 1897 Market is a great AIRPORT spot.  4 stars...I will return next time I'm passing through CLT!

qsJ_8r4EFSieXmj1LLMwSg.text: With a whole restaurant full of empty tables, they made me stand and wait for 10 minutes to seat me in the section they wanted me to sit in. Airport restaurants should be more conscious of their patrons' time.

bikbAPUUsQHYYj7aCek_jg.text: I was very impressed with the food here, especially since it is in an airport! I had the spring salad which included kale, shrimp, strawberries, and nuts and a honey walnut vinaigrette (on the side). I tried the cheese pizza as well which was delicious. We did grab and go for the food and then ate in the middle and they had nice bar top seating with outlets to work on my computer.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheese pizza
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spring Salad

q4QnhbiJ6Shu7ucoKJuXuQ.text: Best airport food ever!  If you sat on the inside or didn't face the interior of the hall you would not believe you were in an airport. Great beer selection. Fresh foods!  AMAZING French onion soup. So cheesy!  Miranda was a great server.

WHhAQuQxckzSoH6rPpbfNA.text: 1897 is not your traditional airport eatery. If you're looking for a place that serves fresh, relatively healthy food, or if you're looking to pick up a quick healthy snack, 1897 is the place to go.   Had their chunky chicken salad sandwich, which was an interesting combination of flavors that made for one delicious sandwich. Chicken, walnuts, pimento cheese and grapes on a warm ciabatta bun all add up to a flavorful meal that satisfied my hunger quickly.   The staff were all friendly and pleasant, it must be that Carolina charm!   Couldn't pick a better place for an airport meal!

pDTPZpaopiQs_ct6FKemhg.text: The service needs to work on their professionalism due to many reasons. Overall, I should not have to ask multiple times to my server to bring me basic things like utensils to eventually tell me to get them myself at the front. I should also be advised when there would be an extra charge to substitute meat when I am vegetarian and should not have to ask you then multiple times to bring it.

flpIS96EhqF0QTM4hmoWiQ.text: I wouldn't even give it a star because I never got waited on at Charlotte airport. I didn't realize I took my invisible pill this morning. I was there for 20 minutes and two servers walked by me at least 5 times and never made eye contact. And with even mediocre food and service I am a more then generous tipper.  I guess selective crappy service is the rage today. Well guess what, it works both ways. I'm not rewarding it any longer.

7FkRKexgitSWb_uKy3MeCQ.text: Wow!  Been in MANY airports, Many of the restaurants and "wine" bars...  this is by far the best one in any airport I have been in!   Great menu, fast service, and awesome staff!  If you have an hour to kill, they make you feel WELCOME to relax in the lounge area!!!  Well done!  Thank you Brittany and the team of service professionals!

OrkU0JlFBKvYOYzHopScww.text: French Onion soup is good.  Chicken Pesto pizza is questionable.  Service is way too slow for an airport.  I've been here before for breakfast, which has been good.  Next time in CLT I'll probably just stand in line at the Chik-Fil-a.

zq8SBjsW4MV65W6S0xp3Aw.text: Ordered the Parmesan fries and Dirty Mac and cheese. Fries were good except several were limp and I like mine crispy. Dirty Mac and cheese $9.99 was very good but pasta was very doughy.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dirty Mac and cheese
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Parmesan fries

YxZ2WGgJfbggYOl-oQhxRg.text: This restaurant is in the Charolette Airport. We really enjoyed their burgers and fries. We tried out the Neese's country burger and the Southern Pride burger.   The Neese's country burger patty was made of a sausage and beef blend. The Southern Pride burger with the sausage link and pimento cheese was delicious!  I had asked for The Southern Pride burger to be medium, but it was definitely well-done. I wish they wouldn't even give the option, if they're not able to do it due to being very busy. We really enjoyed their fries as they were seasoned well with salt and pepper.

CQ0Prc2lbWJVdxA-Hg-fkQ.text: This might be my new favorite dining spot in CLT. It's between 1897 Market and Beaudevin.   While there is ALWAYS a line here, no matter the time (I'm not even kidding), they did get everyone seated quite quickly. There is really a spacious dining area in the back, but you can't see it from the area near the host stand. There's a variety of seating from high tops to bar seats and tables.   I had the Truffle Chicken Sandwich with salt and pepper fries. I am not sure that I have ever had the truffle flavor on chicken, but it worked really nicely. The vegetables were crisp and fresh (especially the lettuce) and the fries have a nice flavor to them. They also have a decent selection of wines, beers, and cocktails (but FYI, the cocktails are ~$17 but have no prices on the menu). I enjoyed the South African Chenin Blanc and was pleased to see that they offered both 6 oz. and 9 oz. pours, which is something your typically only see at a proper wine bar.   You know what--five stars. I don't know if I've ever given a five to an airport restaurant before, but 1897 Market did it right.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Truffle turkey sandwich with salt &amp; pepper fries
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu page 1

XtM8K5QufHYM7mnqJNcr-w.text: This restaurant is much larger than it appears from the entry - don't be deterred by the inevitable line at the host. They seem to have an issue with seating people promptly, but the service is quick after that.   They try hard to have a good ambiance in an airport, with moderate success. The restaurant is still very noisy and cramped. There is not much room for luggage around the tightly packed tables. There was also a saxophonist playing, which made it even more chaotic feeling.   They have a good draft list with some local NC options. The menu is heavy on burgers and sandwiches. I was disappointed to find that the only vegetarian options were flatbread pizzas. How hard could try be to offer a veggie burger substitute?   The mushroom and spinach pizza I ended up with was quite tasty. The crust was impressive - super thin and chewy. Unfortunately in the middle, there seemed to be a hole, or maybe the water from the veggie toppings just made the dough soggy.

_p4-4XVA5W0TdXuLnap0KQ.text: I know people say what do you expect from airport food, but in 2019 I expect a lot. There are real restaurants in airports now with famous chefs. This however isn't one of those places. To be fair it's a market place. I disagree with other reviews; the service mine was excellent. My waitress took my beer order promptly after she helped me select a local beer. I played it safe and ordered the mushroom pizza. The crust is soggy in the center so there's obviously no pizza oven. The pizza sauce lacks real flavor, but in all the pizza is tasty and satisfying. I had 2 hours to kill so I did take my time but my food came out within 5-10 minutes. I don't think the meal took 40 minutes, but I wouldn't come here in a rush. That being said do people come to airport dine-in restaurants when they're in a rush?

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mushroom pizza

_ihY4E3SmKYQe5_HPnpqxg.text: Best airport food! I want to order the farmhouse salad and Brussels again! So I can take it with me on the flight!  Yummy

DM30RLz3O6Ktzji7UpCmWg.text: I wish I'd stopped by this place sooner. A great meal, particularly given its location in CLT.   The shrimp and grits that I had (pictured) were well done. The grits were thick cut, creamy, and golden yellow. The shrimp were sauteed with tomatoes and onions and made a nice rendition of a coastal classic. Prices were reasonable given the location.   Worth a stop!

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and Grits at 1897

TWtFdCzYmW9DzKfOLNVGhw.text: My friends and I were traveling to New Orleans for my birthday and decided to give 1897 Market a try during our layover in Charlotte. We were so disappointed with the pizzas especially after the long wait. It was bland with no flavor whatsoever. I will not be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken pesto
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Glass of Riesling
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Roasted mushroom and spinach pizza

uC3_9MaCCDZehAbWlut69Q.text: As airport food goes, this place was above average when it came to taste. We grabbed breakfast here after our flight was cancelled the night before.   I gave them 3 stars because we waited to be seated when the place wasn't even packed. There were several VISIBLE empty tables. Other people were even waiting in front of us.  My cheese grits and eggs was hot and well seasoned and my friend enjoyed her toast and sausage. We ordered a la carte with no problem.  Another reason for 3 stars was how long it took to get the check. It took at least 10 minutes.

onAAZeUMndMroXgvZ9YYmg.text: The service here is SLOW. Make sure you order as soon as you can and pay when they bring you your meal. Prices are high for the quality of the food. I also don't recommend getting drinks here. They are expensive for what they are. My old fashioned was around 18. The good thing about this place is that the high tables have outlets so you can charge your phone while you wait the 20 minutes to get your stuff. Additionally there was a live sax player which was nice.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burger with the potato wedges (dr the name)
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Old fashioned. Odd way to serve it.

VVYOqFYQ_0_0fumX0KlLlw.text: Meh. It was a place to sit down and eat at the airport and kill a few hours. There was a wait time, but we got seated fairly quickly. Our server was friendly. The other servers were getting behind on orders and the line cooks kept yelling at them to come get their food. I got the chicken strips. They were fine but nothing fancy. Overall it was fine.

5-Eo0pslLykCCiH2FatU_Q.text: I just can't beleave this place. 20 people in line to find a table. So please hurry up and wait. Just a seat for one please. Please hurry up and wait...  Ok. Follow me. All the way to the back. Hardly anyone at the tables. Definitely not packed. Look at the menu. Nice selection, food is made in open kitchen just over there.  Looks good. Smells good.   Breakfast would be nice. Omelette? Eggs over easy? Toast and potatoes? Sourdough toast? Coffee. Hurry up and wait. No waiter? Hurry up and wait. They have pork chops!! Hurry up and wait....  Is this new place at the airport?  I'm not sure the this is m airport and peoples time is scheduled. I had 50 minutes when I got inline.  Now I have only 20. Still no one. So hurry up and get the hell out of there....

YLiB5DBCDX_thDiKLOrDCw.text: We had a 2 1/2 hour layover, it was dinner time, jazz music was playing and our next gate to catch was 10 feet away so why not. The atmosphere was so relaxing, food, service and music were dead on. But as you can see when the bill camp , oh my holy moly. $17.98 for a beer that isn't even a tall one is jut Not Right. And along with $17.25 for a go of wine although it was a 9oz is also just wrong!! Yes I know it is an airport but still it's just Wrong. But besides that the chicken cob salad was absolutely wonderful as well as the chicken tenders. I guess if you're on vacation as these kind of places know it they can charge it. It's up to us if we want to spend that kind of money even before we get to where we are going.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Final Bill

eLJYiabhsJRafomqVfBJAw.text: Horribly disorganized and terrible service. From the cashier sitting on the counter to the employees at the pizza station ignoring the walk up customers standing beneath the "order here" sign. I persevered and ordered my pizza and then walked to the cashier and then walked back to the "order here" as instructed to pick it up. By appearances it looked good but $18 later I had a pizza that was soggy and undercooked in the center and had some black cornmeal dust all over the bottom. It was thickly coated with this burned old cornmeal that gave the pizza an "off" taste (see photo). Ended up feeding the trash can most of the meal because of the raw dough and foul tasting burned cornmeal. $$

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spinach and mushroom pizza - looks good, taste not so much.
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burned cornmeal covering bottom of the pizza

SmebIq77r6aBbKYKhr_CTQ.text: We spent an hour and a half here and only ordered 3 drinks and one turkey sandwich. We almost missed our flight. Seriously disappointed in the service tonight. The turkey was extremely dry and way over done. There was no flavor whatsoever. It was like eating cardboard.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken tenders.... 11 dollars for 3 burnt chicken tenders
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wine selection
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beer menu

kcqyd8JjceinG0eGiw1V1w.text: Stopped in for lunch while on a layover in Charlotte. Wanted a salad so ordered the Cobb Salad. Most was fresh with only some wilted pieces of lettuce. Nice chunks of blue cheese. Some of the turkey had pieces of bone in. Not good.  Service was good and the place was clean.

kyeCtVCtccWD3KRehEbSWw.text: Airport restaurant and bar. Pretty spacious, and on the day before Thanksgiving, the wait was only few minutes, so not too bad!  Service was pleasant and OK! Charlotte burger was delicious-comes with bacon and pimiento cheese. Meat eaters pizza was pretty good too!

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States

NEnzx_ToH4s1ZdWObjZENg.text: This place is a diversion away from your typical airport eateries and serves as a small market in addition to the restaurant. Much to my surprise there was lots of seating to fulfill the hustle and bustle of a busy day at Charlotte Douglas.  Myself and my husband stopped here to grab a good meal before a connecting flight. We wanted breakfast but they had stopped serving it so we went with their lunch options. The service was quick and our food came out pretty fast. I ordered the dirty mac and cheese which was a pile of scrumptious pulled pork on a bowl of creamy pasta. The pasta was much larger pieces than your typical mac and cheese noddles but nonetheless was tasty. It was a decadent dish that I really enjoyed and my husband enjoyed his sandwich. While the options here are limited, everything looked great making this a perfect spot to relax between flights.

u3uJLljFXwki93oacF_ffw.text: Best bacon in the world at this restaurant. We were not happy our layover was so long but having the opportunity to eat here made it a good experience. Great staff and the omelettes were great, healthy, fresh. The bacon though was the best I've ever had.

wkBAX5RdfB6zjBAkrOTYIA.text: Decent pizza for airport food. Wish you could buy half the pizza or by the slice, but you have to buy the whole thing.

MGgG6aZUHsBb8Ekx3z-TjA.text: Not a bad place to grab a meal between flights.   1897 offers pretty quick and courteous service and I enjoyed a decent caesar salad with roasted turkey breast (the turkey was very good, moist and tender) but the french onion soup that I ordered with it was rather so-so.  The gratinee was very thick and gooey and not caramelized at all, although the broth was not bad.  You could certainly do worse - and perhaps better if you've the time look around a bit.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Decent roasted turkey caesar salad
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. The counter seating area and food prep station

M5Rn_pvi99v1_B4h9bSp-Q.text: Had a bit of time to kill between flights. Ordered a glass of wine plus shrimp & grits.  Wasn't overly concerned when the table next to me (they were seated and ordered after I did) received their drinks and food order. 45 minutes later my waitress came around again and sat down to chat with the table next to me (she remembered them from a year ago when they passed through).  I asked about my order. Her response was that they "ran out."  I asked her if she didn't think this was something she might have told me as I sat waiting.  She attempted to make some sort of excuse. I asked for my bill. She brought it to me and at no time did she apologize or offer any sort of compensation for her poor performance.  Needless to say no tip was left, I will not give this establishment any money in the future and will tell everyone about my experience.

EOS8ZBcnI5MZ-TEcVTE3zA.text: This is my favorite place to eat in the CLT airport. By airport standards, it is definitely a five star. By normal restaurant standards, it is a three to four star. This is the best option for a meal in CLT in my opinion.

iUXk9qo_n119_J1xsvyCdg.text: First time in a while for a four star airport place. It was early and the place has a nice vibe and a decent selection of breakfast choices on the menu.  I got the Carolina Slam, two sunny side ups over some great cheese grits with bacon slices and a toasty biscuit. It all worked. Cleaned my bowl and added a tad of Tabasco to my dish up front.   Service friendly for early AM. No $15 Bloody Mary since it was Sunday before noon.  Menu does state this dish has runny eggs and you can ask for them to cook them more if desired.   Will visit again if in the airport. Lots of to go items to choose from as well.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States

sFvT2wc4Fdq9Xk3SLs4fvw.text: My most recent layover was in Charlotte where I had a hungry stomach and 3 hours to kill.  So, I was looking for a spot I could grab a bite and write some Yelp reviews like a good Yelp nerd would.  1897 Market was my spot.  There were a lot of spots on the wall with outlets for charging and electronics using, but have your back to everyone else and I'm not cool with that at the airport: too many weirdoes walking around snooping and doing other weird things.  I asked to sit at a table on the wall and got a good spot.  The food wasn't too bad.  I went with my server's (Zach) advice and order the shrimp and grits.  It went against my better judgment of what I know about food cost to quantity/quality ratio, but I took his advice and it worked out well.  I also got a side salad as well.  Funny thing, but the side salad was served in an odd shaped bowl similar to a soap dish.  It had a weird dip in it; it wasn't quite a bowl but certainly was not a dish.  I had a hard time keeping my tomatoes from squirting up over the sides, rolling off and committing tomatocide off the edge of the table (one actually did).  It wasn't a big deal, but then some French guy the next table over kept coughing up a lung like he had "la bubonic plague" or something, and I started to wonder if I made the right choice of dinner spots.  Then the main course came out and I was relieved.  The shrimp and grits were very good.  The grits came with cheese melted in them, and could have passed for some homemade mashed potatoes.  They also garnished the dish with arugula which gave it a zesty spice.  Last but not lease, there was plenty of shrimp to my delight.

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp &amp; Grits

ZcPN3yls71u-eFZTFWuqmg.text: Mehhhhh, I definitely can do without ever eating a meal here again. The food is pretty bland and nothing stands out. I've eaten here multiple times. Sorry 1897!

T7YXQc4ahjMLgyQTSOEymQ.text: Well.... been a while since I "Yelped". It usually takes something notable to get me to write. Unfortunately for this place, it's not good. The beer was cold, but the large was actually smaller than the small. The chicken wings were decent, but what really moves me to write was the totally apathetic hostess crew. I've never seen a group so determined to start off a seating with a bad vibe. My hostess literally half cleaned my table and took off. I had to get napkins to wipe up the rest of the mess. I almost walked but I'm trying to be a more patient person. My waitress hustled her butt off, even cleaning up broken glass and a spill on an adjacent table because they don't have enough bussers to help her out?? Maybe get some of the flock of slow moving, straight faced hostesses to help her out?! Just saying. Won't eat here again unless I see something close to a smile from the front.

4Mfnj_Q6LDtjmHPWk_MGFg.text: It is an airport restaurant people!  Multiple visits, a couple reviews here.  Overall, interesting setup.  One side is a sit down bar / restaurant and the other side is a cafe style line.  The staff has always been outstanding.  On one visit, I sat at bar.  Great service with a great smile.  I went with the shrimp and grits.  Very good and tasty.  The shrimp were large and plump.  The dish has some cheese and some kind of zesty tangy sauce.  I thought it was awesome, my only complaint, it was small.  I could probably eat two or three dishes of it!!!!  Another review has a pic.....  On another visit, I ordered the breakfast pizza.  Hand made, thin crust pizza cooked in a traditional oven.  One over easy egg was in the center of the pizza........ I actually like sitting on the cafe side, facing the oven.  The cooks were talking to me and having a great time.  I will go back!

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. This French Onion Soup was very tasty.  The hint of red wine is the bomb.

-BNk-7JbavMMBd9mfFXXNw.text: Terrible service, over priced wine and terrible food. Ordered a simple chicken sandwich and my friend ordered pork chop. Both came out AFTER others were seated near us got their food. Food was cold and pork chop was tough. Waitress let us re order so we ordered pizza. How hard is that to mess up. My friends came out good but mine was under cooked. Spoke to a Manager and showed him the bottom of the pizza which was flimsy and under cooked. He agreed. Offered to cook me something else but I already sent 2 entrees back at that point and it was 10p. Manager did take both meals off but wouldve been nice if he had comp'd wine. Wont be going back there. Very disappointing.

nnOHB90YRJK1F9-eiTJLFQ.text: If this place has just a tad more ambience, it would be a five star restaurant for me. However, finding this little gem inside the Charlotte airport was such an awesome thing.  We stopped in thinking it might be a decent place to eat and were so surprised at the quality and creativity of the food we were presented.  I had the BBQ Shrimp and Grits. Folks, it's hard to impress me with grits because I'm from the South and I know what I want in grits. Guess what, this dish had the flavor. It was there! Loved it!   My wife ordered the Chicken Pesto Pasta and the French Onion Soup. Boom!!!!! Best choices ever! The soup was probably one of the best French Onion soups we have had. The Chicken Pesto Pasta was delicious. We had a great evening and if it were a touch more romantic, I would give it that last star. But hey, what do you expect out of an airport restaurant.  With that said, check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Chicken Pesto Pasta had the flavor! It is definitely worth trying.
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. This is the French Onion Soup after my wife already dug in. Awesome!
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. This is the BBQ Shrimp and Grits! The Shrimp are hidden under that arugula. You have to take a bite of all three elements at once.

zWYqJZ1cbjMrDUuT1hborQ.text: Now open where Chili's used to be, between the A and B concourses in the Charlotte airport, you'll find the 1897 Market. And wow, what a spot. If you had asked me yesterday what was the best food choice in CLT, I'd have said the burger bar in C. Now, I'm not so sure.  1897 has it all. Pizzas made to order in a gas oven. Sandwiches made to order. A large selection of grab-and-go that looks amazingly awesome. There was a container of Queen Charlotte's Pimiento Cheese in there that caught my eye. Mmmmm... tasty!  And to top it all off, a large bar on the atrium side that has local brews on tap! Yep, even the award winning Hop-Drop-And-Roll and my own favorite, the Jalapeno Pale Ale. Jeez, Louise. I might have to arrange more layovers here just to eat!

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#34;Charlotte Burger&#34; with parmesan fries at 1897.
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Or sit. 1897 Market at CLT.
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grab and go. 1897 Market at CLT.

7RmPjZ9GMJq5evb3PSHt4Q.text: Hmmm - the 1897 Market - we've all waiting so long for this place to open and it was worth the wait.  This place is perhaps the best place in the entire airport! Check out the pictures everyone is taking and you will agree it's amazing. Clean - new - great staff - fresh food - decent pricing and a huge variety - they even sell a few items - shop - eat - drink - relax and it seems like it's always close to my gate!  This place is a GREAT new addition to one of MY favorite airports!

photos.caption: Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of 1897 Market - Charlotte, NC, United States

HK9_kPBb5bjrt-Pm15Cziw.text: I've never been here for breakfast before but was pleasantly surprised. The egg white blt omelet was just the right version of feeling healthy and feeling like my heart was happily clogging with some delicious bacon. The staff was nice. Beware that you are in an airport so it is pricier than most. However, when you think of options in the CLT airport, this restaurants feels like one of the best options

yGDd7pWLq8T4SrhH6DgTHw.text: Worst service I have had in a restaurant so far this year! French Onion Soup, usually a favorite of mine, was watery, thin, and just overall not very good. "Shrimp and Grits" was luke warm at best, small non juicy shrimp. Ordered an ice tea that never came, but came on the check :) That was the only time server followed up. STAY AWAY - other in terminal options - don't stop at first like I did, LOL

wbd2goZtz9kvqW64mZG_ww.text: Airport market with quick food and drinks. The secret is the back area lounge hidden away from the bustle of the main area with comfy couches and seating, power outlets to charge and a TV. It's also decently quite. The rest of the market is similar to an open indoor market feel with multiple food stalls, but much smaller and tighter walking areas.

oxtkN5zTGxk_kTiDBx0Q7Q.text: Pretty quick airport food and not bad in quality either.  I ordered the salmon salad and a side of brussel spourts. The salad was great, a nice light dinner after a long day of traveling but the brussell spourt was a bit too heavy on the sauce.  The service was quick and I like alot, made it easy to get in get fed and get out and onto the plane.

P5oO284vPRH96bq2BsaZGw.text: There is nothing to complain about here! Quick seating, quick and attentive service, and good tasting food.  A good choice to have a layover meal.  I couldn't tell I was in the airport!  The chicken truffle sandwich I had had a tender chicken breast that seamed very fresh. The mushrooms, tomato, cheese were a great compliment to the chicken.  The coffee was phenomenal, like it came from an independent coffee bar.

HxHiTxFZYB9jmKLMGNer6w.text: Why 4 stars? Because this is one of the better options at CLT.     ---   ---   ---  "Eatin' good" is tough to do while traveling, so I set a very low standard for meal with this pass-through: find something healthy. I chose 1897 because their mission was fresh food, and they had a few different salad options.  And then I ordered the pretzel burger because I have a problem.  My burger was solid, but I was kicking myself for passing on the french onion soup. I sat at the end of the bar, right next to the open kitchen and watched delicious french onion soup being distributed time after time after time. I will definitely be trying that out on my next visit. My parmesan fries were fine, in its place.  The only gripe I had was that during my visit, the Charlotte Hornets were playing a playoff Game 7, and the TV's were on ESPN2, which had bowling on. I asked a couple times for them to switch the TV's, but it didn't happen until about my 5 minutes before I had to leave. That may sound nit-picky, but how do you not have your local team's big playoff game on, and why does it take 15-20 minutes to change the channel?  At any rate, this will probably be my stop at future visits to the airport. Next time, I'll get the salad (and the french onion soup, of course.)

gqhxxG95NjeQNTJu-08AIQ.text: Our waitress was on point (Maribeth) and the food was tasty and quick. I had the turkey and white cheddar omelet and found it to be very good and just the right amount of food. My husband had the grits and found it tasty although a bit sweet for his taste, due to the tomato jam.

R75O8NhTmUKDfhCXzOUBvQ.text: Well I stopped here for breakfast after I saw the reviews. Waitress was friendly. Food  was sub par. The eggs were hard cooked and I was told the cheese did it. . Really and she was serious. The potatoes were cold and I had 10 on my plate. The grits were room temperature and bland. This stood up to airport food. I think had the grits been warm they would of been a hit. The eggs were lost in transition

hdx8xKQrqtfcHh9aSoJCnQ.text: Ordered a protein box and a bottle of Perrier for over $16. Overly priced. The lounge/rest area was nice. But was dirty at one end. I sat there for 2 hours. No one came and cleaned the tables.

_JKvf-pS8kXUgeo8Iam3_A.text: Pleasantly surprised about the food offerings here while waiting for our trip back to Vegas.  I ordered the goat cheese salad with salmon.  It was quite tasty!

OQY5xhS8K_NYPcIbZOi9FQ.text: Hands down best airport food. Actually excellent food all around.  The spinach and mozzarella pizza was awesome. The young lady that took care of me "Chanae" was incredible. She was attentive and on her game.  Having had some experience in the restaurant arena, I know for sure she is a real asset to The business

9TdO9zhNNCvaigoShCbsLQ.text: Service is absolutely horrible.  They are way too slow for an airport.  No one at an airport has time for a leisurely meal.  Step up your game or get out.

z0l9q-QJVFAtxqo68DLaXg.text: Staff is super nice and effective. I enjoyed a delicious local beer and shrimp toast. It was a toasted piece of sourdough with an avocado spread, mound of aruglia, cherry tomatoes, a bit of pickled onion and 3 blackened shrimp..yum! The greens have an amazing dressing...this is my new stop at the Charlotte airport!

RTBWF7Vw453uxvQrpJLLww.text: Think I found my new favorite place to eat in between flights while in Charlottle. 1897 Market is in the main concourse between terminals B and C. They offer a small variety of salads, burgers, pizza and larger entrees, with little something for everyone. The food was great. Service was quick and friendly. There are limited take outs available (pizza and salads) around the back. I had the burger and parmesan fries and it was a solid choice. Next time I might have to try the dirty mac and cheese. All in all, a relaxing and pleasant spot to grab a bite in between flights. Absolutely no complaints!

grp4cYyyrW9b3uwLqNXfZA.text: This is a great restaurant for the airport!  I really like not only the food, but also the atmosphere. I generally eat here for breakfast and I am really pleased with the quality and freshness of their food. The fruit salad was great and the bacon and eggs are too.

CJOR4oq122UGUB0SivHLDg.text: Great for airport food. Get a sandwich made as the grab and goes are a little soggy. Fresh food and healthy options. Expensive!!!!!! But better than the usual trash you eat at an airport.

3vMTOgn16tLpKVZETcB3aA.text: 1897 gives you options for fresh food at the airport which is appreciated. You can also grab something for the road from deli/grocery side of the restaurant. The service is friendly and prompt.   A good place to get a nice meal.

YCrjy0MB1AdnlYLiWBV7bQ.text: I wish they had this place at every airport! Grilled chicken salad was infinitely fresher than nearby at CPK, with fun extra ingredients like quinoa and oatmeal. And with the honey walnut vinaigrette dressing it was actually really good. Great open layout with booths, tables, high tops, bar seating, couches. The only thing that would make this place even better would be wifi. Would love to come back whenever my plans take me through this airport.
